启蒙 → 幼教 → 小学 → 中学 → 大学 → 工作 → 家庭 → 生活 → 晚年
擅长学习，突破自我，是成功者最根本的本领，也是安身立命之本 △♂你♀有多久沒有好好学习了？生活日复一日 ◐ 相似的过程与结局持续上演中，我们坚持走出舒适区，保持学习态。学 让我们懂得抓不懈必有所获。回家的路不止一条 ╬ 你探索了几条?人生要紧几步 ⇒ 必须要有归零的心态,思想上从零开始,实践中从零做起,把心态调整到坐标原点 ⦿
学 让我们懂得知敬畏而后严谨。学而不思 不进 ⊠ 思而不用 则退 ←学无止境 ∞ 不负时光 我们一直在路上 →

translations.title:
时尚造型思考
Stylised Your Thinking!
translations.name: Allien Gan
translations.bio: Allien Gan is a Shanghai-based freelance fashion stylist. His talent for styling was first unearth by a judge during a blind audition for the reality TV show, I Wanna Be A Model. At the 2010 STYLO fashion week, Gan debuted his avant-garde collection which incorporated recycled materials into its design. His resourcefulness proved to be useful and laid the foundation for his styling career when he moved to Shanghai for better prospects in 2013. Gan has worked with major fashion labels like Louis Vuitton, Burberry, and Michael Kors; he has also done styling works for artists including Zhang Ziyi, Tang Wei, Dilraba Dilmurat, and Jackson Yee.
translations.introduction: Shanghai-based freelance fashion stylist Allien Gan has collaborated with international stars and world-class brands as their image consultant. However, instead of visiting luxurious fashion houses for his pieces, Gan preferred to explore hardware stores and second-hand shops. He believes in sourcing locally, storing efficiently and improvising intelligently according to his client. Gan advocates that everyone should be finding their own self-worth and value on their own stage.

translations.title:
时尚造型思考
Stylised Your Thinking!
translations.name: 颜永佳
translations.bio: Allien 颜永佳，整体造型师。理科出生的他自认从小没有艺术天分，却在一次《我要做模特》节目盲选面试中偶然被评审发掘造型师天赋。2010年的STYLO时装周中，他首次把环保概念融入造型设计。他的物尽其用和急中生智，为未来在上海的造型事业奠定基础。2013年到上海发展至今，Allien坚持用实力打动顾客的理念，成功虏获各大国际品牌如Louis Vuitton、Burberry、Michael Kors等的芳心。如今已是国际品牌御用时尚搭配师的他，更曾为章子怡、汤唯、迪丽热巴、易烊千玺等人做造型。
translations.introduction: 小至咖啡杯，大至会场主题设计，生活处处有时尚。与国际巨星合作、当知名品牌顾问，常与时尚挂钩的整体造型师 Allien 颜永佳最常光顾的并非名牌商店，而是五金店和二手材料店。就地取材，充分储材，再依人施材，对于顾客要求应对自如的他认为，人人都应该在各自的舞台中寻找自我风格，定位自我价值。

title: Circular Economy
name: T. A. Wu
bio: Wu Ting An (T.A. Wu) is the founder of W Glass Project in Taiwan. Wu spent his childhood in a glass recycling factory, before completing his degree in Resource Engineering at the National Cheng Kung University; he also did a Master’s degree in Industrial Systems, Manufacture and Management at the University of Cambridge. After returning to Taiwan, Wu took over the family glass recycling business. He started W Glass Project in 2017 as a collaborative platform to create innovative glass products from the combined expertise of designers and glass artisans using recycled glass from Spring Pool. Some of the products include glass straw, beer mugs, and the award-winning FLOAT non-straw glass cup for bubble tea.
introduction: Wu Ting An (T.A. Wu) is the Managing Director of Spring Pool Glass and the founder of W Glass Project in Taiwan. Wu spent his childhood in a glass recycling factory, before completing his degree in Resource Engineering at the National Cheng Kung University; he also did a Master’s degree in Industrial Systems, Manufacture and Management at the University of Cambridge. After returning to Taiwan, Wu took over the family glass recycling business. He started W Glass Project in 2017 as a collaborative platform to create innovative glass products from the combined expertise of designers and glass artisans using recycled glass from Spring Pool. Some of the products include glass straw, beer mugs, and the award-winning FLOAT non-straw glass cup for bubble tea.

event.title: Relearn
event.description:
Since the day we came into this world, from our baby crawls to walking properly, from expressing joy, happiness, sorrow, and anger. We collectively learn from our daily observations through our hearts. We enter new stages of life at every interval, and past experiences then serve as our invisible guide to behave, perform, and improve our lives. How long has it been since you last learned diligently? The repetitive processes keep going on.

Going back to ground zero with our hearts composed, by releasing all knowledge gained and letting go, we seek new knowledge, begin drawing the line from a dot, which then diversifies, amplifies, and spreads into various ideas and concepts. Progress would not happen if there's no discernment after learning. Slack and incompetence would take place if there's no practice after discernment. Just like sailing against strong currents, the continuous quest for learning to acquire new knowledge, and the ability to adapt and be flexible during uncertainties lead to viable and positive outcomes resulting from changes. ‘Borderless’ in learning, let's get inspired by the beauty of learning.

translations.title: 回收 ≠ 再循环，不用吸管喝珍珠
translations.name: 吴庭安
translations.occupation: 春池玻璃W春池计划创办人
translations.bio: 吴庭安，春池玻璃W春池计划创办人。从小在玻璃回收厂长大的他毕业自成功大学资源工程系、英国剑桥工业管理学系。返台后，他到台积电工作，后因体恤父亲，而决定继承家业。2017年，他推出 “W 春池计划” ，以 “回收” 及 “推动循环经济” 为理念，利用春池的回收玻璃、玻璃师傅手艺，以及与优秀的设计者跨界合作，制造玻璃吸管、漂浮奶茶杯、啤酒杯等，当中 “漂浮奶茶杯” 在今年 “新一代金点新秀设计奖” 中勇夺产学合作类金奖。
translations.introduction: 从小在玻璃回收厂长大，继承家业后，吴庭安开发了 W 春池计划，把玻璃废料再循环，设计成有价值的产品，推动回收经济。循环经济，从源头就要减少废弃物，兼以人为本，创造需求。制作老宅隔热建材、漂浮奶茶杯、废玻璃展览等；串联当地设计师、厂商、手作人，赋予再循环玻璃新生态，创造良好效应。每个微小，聚集起来可以变成大力量，让环保散落在我们的生活中。

title: The Art of Dance
name: Anthony Meh
bio: Anthony Meh, dancer and choreographer. After leaving Malaysia for international stage for around a decade, he returned, and both him and his partner set up the first professional dance group of Malaysian Chinese Community named: Dua Space. With choreographic works such as “Ancient Inscriptions”, the epic drama “Anak Malaysia”, up to the recent “Encore Melaka” and etc, all of them demonstrated his comprehension of the local Chinese context through exploring its historical trail, with the hope that this land would come up with its own way of embracing art. To him art is not a river by itself, but a collection of all rivers. Along the way, art of dancing has become his faith. He constantly resetting himself to zero and leaving behind the essential nutrients to the next generation, in order to foster this small tree, so that when it grows up to be a large tree, it will form a canopy for the art of dancing of Malaysia.
introduction: Dancer and choreographer Anthony Meh believes that the origin of art is life, and life enriches art. There are a lot of creative materials hidden in life, and dances are filled with symbolism of life. Once inspired by the omnipresent vine plants, he choreographed dance moves with metaphor of pragmatic endurance in the face of hardship. He would like to let the public know that life and art are inseparable, and dance serves as the bridge to connect people and art.

translations.title: 怎样鉴赏艺术?
translations.name: 马金泉
translations.bio: 马金泉，舞蹈家兼编舞家。出走到国际舞台约10年后，归来与搭档成立了大马华社第一支专业舞团 - 共享空间。舞蹈作品《万象甲骨》、史诗舞剧《大马薪传》，乃至近期《又见 · 马六甲》等，从探索本土华人事迹当中，去了解本土，希望这片土地拥有自己拥抱艺术的方式。艺术于他并非河流，而是所有河流的汇集。一路走来，舞蹈艺术却成了他的信仰。他让自己不断归零，把养分留给下一代，让这棵小树，在形成大树后，覆荫大马的舞蹈艺术。
translations.introduction: 对舞蹈兼编舞家马金泉而言，艺术源于生活，而生活则丰富了艺术，生活潜藏着创作的素材，舞蹈更充满了生活的符码，他曾以处处可见的“藤”为创作，以舞姿隐喻人面对困境时可屈可伸的态度，他想告诉群众，生活与艺术密不可分，舞蹈则是连接人与艺术的桥梁。

title: Art Appreciation: Sharing & Interaction
name: Dua Space Dance Theatre
bio: In 1998, when the soil of Malaysian art was still impoverished, Anthony Meh and Aman Yap Choong Boon established the first full-time professional dance group of the Malaysian Chinese community. In tune with the dance group’s English name “Dua Space”, which implies the coexistence of sharing and communication, the group has performed in China, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Japan, Korea, Britain, Spain and so on since its founding in 1998, and has brought the art of Malaysia to the international stage. With twenty years of hard work, they have won numerous prestigious awards at homeland and abroad. Recent well-known performances include Amidst The Wind, The Lotus Sutra, Ancient Inscriptions and so on. They prepared the soil of Malaysian dance realm from scratch, and that can be regarded as the flower of perseverance that blooms from the concrete slab.

translations.title: 舞者 ⇌ 观众 = 共鸣共存
translations.name: 共享空间专业舞团
translations.bio: 1998年，在大马艺术土壤贫瘠的时候，马金泉与叶忠文创立了首个大马华社全职专业舞团。与舞团英译 “Dua Space” 寓意共享与交流相形一彰的是，创立至今曾在中、港、台、日、韩、英国、西班牙等地演出，让大马艺术延伸至国际舞台。二十年的耕耘，他们荣获无数国内外知名大奖，近期知名演出包括《风中二十》、《法华经：舞动和平共生妙旋律》、《万象甲骨》等。从无到有，为大马舞蹈界翻土掘地的他们，可称之为水泥地里开出的那朵坚毅之花。

title: The Langur Monkey's Cradle
name: Jo Leen Yap
bio: Jo Leen Yap is the leader of the Langur Project Penang (LPP), a conservation program for langurs. As a a promising young primatologist, she would carry out her mission for observation in sweat along her telescope, navigation system and notepad into the forest that most people would choose to stay away from, in order to save the endangered primate langurs. The chivalrous “monkey woman” who was rescued by shy yet adorable white-eyed langurs before, relied on long hours observation to record and study langurs, who are way lesser-known than chimpanzees and orangutans, in order to understand how langurs endure the shattered habitat and the dynamic coexistence between humans and animals.
introduction: Compared to chimpanzees and orangutans, white-eyed langurs are a much lesser known species of endangered primates, consequently most people do not understand that white-eyed langurs' natural habitat has been jeopardized to fulfill human needs. As the leader of the conservation project, Jo Leen Yap carries out her observation in the forest. Besides that, she also organizes guided outdoor tours to raise public awareness towards langurs, and also to educate the public about the importance of coexistence between humans and animals.

translations.title: The Langur Monkey's Cradle
translations.name: Jo Leen Yap
translations.bio: Jo Leen Yap is the leader of the Langur Project Penang (LPP), a conservation program for langurs. As a a promising young primatologist, she would carry out her mission for observation in sweat along her telescope, navigation system and notepad into the forest that most people would choose to stay away from, in order to save the endangered primate langurs. The chivalrous “monkey woman” who was rescued by shy yet adorable white-eyed langurs before, relied on long hours observation to record and study langurs, who are way lesser-known than chimpanzees and orangutans, in order to understand how langurs endure the shattered habitat and the dynamic coexistence between humans and animals.
translations.introduction: Compared to chimpanzees and orangutans, white-eyed langurs are a much lesser known species of endangered primates, consequently most people do not understand that white-eyed langurs' natural habitat has been jeopardized to fulfill human needs. As the leader of the conservation project, Jo Leen Yap carries out her observation in the forest. Besides that, she also organizes guided outdoor tours to raise public awareness towards langurs, and also to educate the public about the importance of coexistence between humans and animals.

translations.title: 不吃香蕉的猴子保育
translations.name: 叶茹琳
translations.bio: 叶茹琳，眼镜食叶猴保育计划主持人。身为灵长类系博士生的她，任务是流着汗、拿着望远镜、导航系统与记事本走进一般人都不会接近的森林去做观察，为的就是拯救濒危灵长类动物食叶眼镜猴。这位曾被有着害羞天性与可爱白眼框食叶猴救回一命的 “猴侠” 女子，靠着长时间的观察与记录关注度远不及黑猩猩与人猿的食叶猴，了解食叶猴如何忍受栖息地被分裂以及人类与动物的共存启发。
translations.introduction: 比起黑猩猩与人猿，人们对同为濒危灵长动物的眼镜食叶猴的关注非常有限，自然也不了解食叶猴正因人类非法喂养与栖息地被瓜分，其生存形态遭破坏。身为食叶猴保育计划主持人的叶茹琳，为了保育食叶猴，除了到森林实地考察外，也策划户外导览，让民众认识食叶猴也教育群众，人类与动物共存的重要性。

title: Artificial Intelligence – Prevent Fails
name: Dr. Lim Meng Hui
bio: Dr. Lim Meng Hui is the co-founder and CEO of SmartPeep, a med-tech company that develops a patient monitoring system using artificial intelligence (AI). Dr. Lim has experience in conducting research in multimodal biometric recognition and pattern recognition, while also taught web AI, during his stint as a research assistant professor at the Hong Kong Baptist University. He started SmartPeep with his team to reduce the number and impact of falls in hospitals/elderly homes by developing an AI camera monitoring system, which can inform nurses and caregivers when high fall-risk patients get out of bed without assistance.
introduction: Compared to chimpanzees and orangutans, white-eyed langurs are a much lesser known species of endangered primates, consequently most people do not understand that white-eyed langurs' natural habitat has been jeopardized to fulfill human needs. As the leader of the conservation project, Jo Leen Yap carries out her observation in the forest. Besides that, she also organizes guided outdoor tours to raise public awareness towards langurs, and also to educate the public about the importance of coexistence between humans and animals.

translations.title: 人工智能 = 防摔
translations.name: 林铭辉博士
translations.occupation: 医疗智能看护系统SmartPeep联合创办人
translations.bio: 林铭辉博士，医疗智能看护系统SmartPeep联合创办人。林博士在求学期间与教授一同研究面部识别的经历让他与AI结下了不解之缘。曾担任研究助理教授的他，致力于专研生物识别、多模态生物识别和模式识别的同时，也投身人工智能相关的教学事业。一次的香港国际科技研讨会RISE，让他把最擅长的AI从学界转战商界。他与太太联合创立了SmartPeep，利用人工智能技术降低老年病人的跌伤风险。从研究AI转至实际应用AI的他认为，人生要摔，但科技必须防摔!
translations.introduction: 林铭辉博士因为受到婆婆跌倒事件的启发，决定组织团队一起研发 SmartPeep 人工智能看护系统，在老人家跌倒时能及时通知看护或是他的家人，以免错过黄金救命时间而酿成悲剧。它已成功协助超过500宗具跌倒风险的案例，而且其探测准确度也已达到 95% 的高精准水平。

title: Deep – Thinking – Process
name: Fariz Hanapiah
occupation: Co-founder and Creative Director of Motiofixo
bio: Fariz Hanapiah is the co-founder and Creative Director of Motiofixo, an agency specialising in a spectrum of creative executions - from advertising and branding to projection mapping and film production. Fariz started to explore with computer coding and programming - and created his first website - when he was thirteen. His boundless creativity drove him to establish Motiofixo with his team, which provided them with a platform to unleash their range of ideas and to explore storytelling via various mediums and technology. Motiofixo grew from a team of six to thirty-six staff within three years, and they continue to believe that having fun along the process will produce innovative results.
introduction: Fariz Hanapiah was fascinated by creative work since his childhood. In 2007, Fariz and his team founded Motiofixo as a platform to showcase their ideas. His forte is to tell stories with visual arts: from idea to experimentation then execution; from music, visuals to projection mapping and augmenting reality scenes, Fariz explored every possibility in the field of new media. To Fariz, the joyful part about creativity is how we can effectively employ technology as an enabler to spread ideas and help others.

translations.title: Deep – Thinking – Process
translations.name: Fariz Hanapiah
translations.occupation: Motiofixo联合创办人兼创意总监
translations.bio: Fariz Hanapiah，Motiofixo联合创办人兼创意总监。当13岁同龄朋友沉迷于打游戏时，Fariz开始研究与利用电脑编码和图像制作自己的足球网站。从小极具创意的思维从未停止，而Motiofixo是他与团队大展想法的自由平台。Fariz擅长用视觉艺术说故事，从概念到执行，从音乐影像到光雕投影，在新媒体艺术领域里，发掘各种可能。有趣的是，3年间从6人发展至36人团队的Motiofixo理念是 “好玩” ，他们相信好玩的状态会带来出色表现！视觉艺术不再平面，Fariz与团队也迈向更丰富的未来。
translations.introduction: 从小就着迷于创作，直至2007年，Fariz 与团队创办了可以大展想法的 Motiofixo 平台。他擅长用视觉艺术说故事，从概念到实验到执行，从音乐影像到光雕投影到扩增实景，在新媒体领域里，发掘各种可能。科技对 Fariz 来说是优质工具，而人如何有效利用工具来传达理念，才是创作好玩的地方！

title: Rappers: We Are Malaysians
name:
SRP Project
(Silk Road Pirates)
bio: What is Hip Hop - in a Malaysian context? SRP Project is the brainchild of rapper MC BeeMan from local Cantonese rap band, ManHanD. In an effort to explore how multicultural Malaysia can present its own twist on the genre, he assembled a team of talents from diverse backgrounds for this project, where they try to break down the cultural and language barriers to create a uniquely Malaysian piece. ‘Silk Road Pirates’ is the result of their collaboration, and they hope to encourage more Malaysian singers to assimilate their unique heritage and culture into music. Besides MC BeeMan, the team also consists of rappers Wo Shi Jay, Noyz134, Supa Mojo, Yang Ariff; graffiti artist Nestwo; music producer Navin Navigator; and DJ Neshtro.

translations.title: 嘻哈大马?
translations.name: 大马嘻哈计划
translations.bio: 嘻哈，一种集合音乐 (DJ)、文学 (说唱)、运动 (街舞) 及视觉 (涂鸦) 元素的全方位文化创作。这是发起自本土广东饶舌乐团慢行 (ManHanD) 队长MC Bee的嘻哈计划，成员跨越三大种族。当中包括说唱歌手Wo Shi Jay、Noyz134、Supa Mojo、Yang Ariff、涂鸦艺术家Nestwo，音乐制作人Navin Navigator及调音师Deejay Neshtro。来自不同文化背景的他们想用创作打破嘻哈界各种族之间的文化隔阂，因此制作了 “SilkRoad Pirates” 鼓励歌手以最擅长的语言展现各自的独有嘻哈文化，大胆运用多元文化的特点来实现艺术的无远弗届。

title: Reflecting on Humanity by Inspecting History
name: Koh Kok Wee
bio: As a history graduate, Koh Kok Wee has a knack for writing news commentary using historical narratives. He believes that many current events and development have a pattern of historical reenactment due to the constant of human nature. Therefore, by using stories from our history to discuss news, Koh polishes the rough dissonance that the public has towards history into news that resonated with all, thus allowing people to learn from them. He is aware that commentary on current affairs can be a double-edged sword; however, while he was sometimes heavily criticized, Koh believes that it is necessary to analyze current issues from different angles to initiate people to think and discuss.
introduction: As a history graduate, Koh Kok Wee has a knack for writing news commentary using historical narratives. He believes that many current events and development have a pattern of historical reenactment due to the constant of human nature. Therefore, by using stories from our history to discuss news, Koh polishes the rough dissonance that the public has towards history into news that resonated with all, thus allowing people to learn from them. He is aware that commentary on current affairs can be a double-edged sword; however, while he was sometimes heavily criticized, Koh believes that it is necessary to analyze current issues from different angles to initiate people to think and discuss. In his work, Koh abides by this quote from the late Chinese historian and social critic Bo Yang: “Do not sing for the king, but speak for the people”.

event.title: Reset
event.description:
A sudden infectious outbreak, the world was brought to an abrupt halt. When time seems to have stopped, it's about spending time on our own. Since we can’t travel abroad; let's open up and dive into our hearts.

Life is close at hand yet ephemeral; let’s cherish it while it lasts. We introspect and evaluate, followed by
overturn, then breakthrough; when time seems to stand still, we push the axle forward silently……

Once the “reset button” is pressed, step forward with your feet up. Instead of a lonely hesitation to start
from scratch, it's about changing your attitude and going all out.

Enduring hardship and toughening ourselves up; staying composed and shining bright alternately. Return to
where we begin and cultivate ourselves in the iteration. Just go against all odds, as time and tide wait for no man.

In the eyes are sun, moon, and stars, sometimes dark and sometimes bright, thus twinkle; in the heart, there are mountains and rivers, ups and downs in motion, thus immortal.

In the eyes are sun, moon, and stars, sometimes dark and sometimes bright, thus twinkle; in the heart, there are mountains and rivers, ups and downs in motion, thus immortal.

translations.title: 啟
translations.description:
一场突如其来的疫情，蓦然为世界按下“暂停键”，岁月看似停滞不前，实为容许更多和自己相处的时间。既出不了国门；我们打开心门，去深度探索吧！生命近在咫尺；却又转瞬即逝，就珍而重之吧！我们反思、审视;进而推翻、突破；于仿佛停驻的时光里，默默推动前进的轮轴。
“重启键”一触,举足迈步,
不是从零开始的孤独踟蹰,
而是换个姿态方式再全力以赴。
|
风雨洗礼，淬火磨炼；
沉淀有时，盛放有时。
迭代之中，归本深耕；
砥砺前行，莫负韶华。
|
眼里有日月星辰，忽明忽暗，因此闪烁；
心中载山川河流，高低起伏，所以不朽。

translations.title: Reflecting on Humanity by Inspecting History
translations.name: Koh Kok Wee
translations.bio: As a history graduate, Koh Kok Wee has a knack for writing news commentary using historical narratives. He believes that many current events and development have a pattern of historical reenactment due to the constant of human nature. Therefore, by using stories from our history to discuss news, Koh polishes the rough dissonance that the public has towards history into news that resonated with all, thus allowing people to learn from them. He is aware that commentary on current affairs can be a double-edged sword; however, while he was sometimes heavily criticized, Koh believes that it is necessary to analyze current issues from different angles to initiate people to think and discuss.
translations.introduction: As a history graduate, Koh Kok Wee has a knack for writing news commentary using historical narratives. He believes that many current events and development have a pattern of historical reenactment due to the constant of human nature. Therefore, by using stories from our history to discuss news, Koh polishes the rough dissonance that the public has towards history into news that resonated with all, thus allowing people to learn from them. He is aware that commentary on current affairs can be a double-edged sword; however, while he was sometimes heavily criticized, Koh believes that it is necessary to analyze current issues from different angles to initiate people to think and discuss. In his work, Koh abides by this quote from the late Chinese historian and social critic Bo Yang: “Do not sing for the king, but speak for the people”.

translations.title: 读历史写评论鉴人性
translations.name: 许国伟
translations.bio: 台大历史系毕业的许国伟，擅长用历史写新闻评论。他认为，因为人性的不变，导致许多时事的发展脉络逃不开一次次历史的重演。于是，他选择用故事说历史；用历史论新闻，从而把历史的生涩冲淡，加深大众对新闻的共鸣感，以此来借鉴大众。他深知，时事评论是把双刃剑，须时时兼听，不可偏信。即使有时会遭千夫指，也该多角度分析时事，才能引发大众的思考和讨论。
translations.introduction: 台大历史系毕业的许国伟，擅长用历史写新闻评论。他认为，因为人性的不变，导致许多时事的发展脉络逃不开一次次历史的重演。于是，他选择用故事说历史; 用历史论新闻，从而把历史的生涩冲淡，加深大众对新闻的共鸣感，以此来借鉴大众。他深知，时事评论是把双刃剑，须时时兼听，不可偏信。即使有时会遭千夫指，也该多角度分析时事，才能引发大众的思考和讨论。因此，一路走来，他始终在时事评论中遵循柏杨说过的一句话，"不为君王唱赞歌，只为苍生说人话。"

title: Rethink Clay in Social Practice
name: James Seet
bio: Sculptor and creative director James Seet has worked in Malaysia's ceramics industry for over 20 years. To him, clay represents mother earth and it carries the meaning of regeneration and healing - hence one can feel the humanistic care and love in his work. In 2021, using the grant he successfully applied from the Cultural Economy Development Agency (CENDANA), Seet combined pottery and music by creating 20 pieces of percussion music instruments out of ceramics, which produced an earthy, ethereal sound. He hopes that his creation is able to comfort and provide a renewed sense of optimism to people during this pandemic.
introduction: “As artists, we must evaluate our self-existence to achieve humanity. Creating art with compassion is my way of giving back to society.” Sculptor James Seet is passionate about devoting himself to public art. Over the years, he has been using pottery as a medium to connect and influence society. To him, pottery is life and is humanistic - his creations always reflected love and care. Seet co-organised an exhibition with the Women’s Aid Organisation (WAO) where he created 15 head sculptures of women, representing female victims of domestic violence, to raise awareness of the issue. During the pandemic, he created ceramic musical instruments which incorporated elements from nature, hoping to reignite hope into people’s lives using the comforting power of music. Through the art of pottery, Seet learnt about patience and tranquility. He hopes to speak up for social issues and connect with more people via pottery.

event.title: Reset
event.description:
A sudden infectious outbreak, the world was brought to an abrupt halt. When time seems to have stopped, it's about spending time on our own. Since we can’t travel abroad; let's open up and dive into our hearts.

Life is close at hand yet ephemeral; let’s cherish it while it lasts. We introspect and evaluate, followed by
overturn, then breakthrough; when time seems to stand still, we push the axle forward silently……

Once the “reset button” is pressed, step forward with your feet up. Instead of a lonely hesitation to start
from scratch, it's about changing your attitude and going all out.

Enduring hardship and toughening ourselves up; staying composed and shining bright alternately. Return to
where we begin and cultivate ourselves in the iteration. Just go against all odds, as time and tide wait for no man.

In the eyes are sun, moon, and stars, sometimes dark and sometimes bright, thus twinkle; in the heart, there are mountains and rivers, ups and downs in motion, thus immortal.

translations.title: 用陶艺为社会议题发声
translations.name: 薛文杰
translations.occupation: 雕塑艺术家兼创意总监
translations.bio: 薛文杰，雕塑艺术家兼创意总监。在大马陶艺界耕耘 20 余年的他，创作风格多样化，曾多次在国内外举办展览，致力于以艺术实践作为载体，连接社会、影响社会。于他而言，泥象征大地之母，兼具再生和疗愈的含义；而在他的作品当中，总能体现出关怀与爱的人文风情。2021 年，他成功申请并获得艺术经济发展机构 (CENDANA) 所发放的拨款，因此选择将陶艺与音乐相结合，首创了 20 件极具艺术美感的陶作乐器，以演奏和敲击奏出空灵万变的大地之声，希望借此创举于新冠疫情期间安抚人心并带来新希望。
translations.introduction: “作为一名艺术家，我们必须评估自我存在，以实现人性。以慈悲心创作艺术，这是我回馈社会的方式。” 雕塑艺术家薛文杰热衷投身于公共艺术，多年来以陶艺品作为载体，连接社会、影响社会。于他而言，陶就是生命，是有人性的。而在他的作品当中，总能体现出关怀与爱的人文风情 ——与妇女援助组织 (WAO) 合作举办展览，制作了15个女性人头雕塑以代表家庭暴力中的女性受害者，旨在提高人们对此问题的认识；疫情受困在家期间，还首创了融合大自然设计元素的陶作乐器，希望借由音乐的力量安抚人心，点燃生命希望。他从陶艺创作中学会耐心及保持平静，重获了生活的力量。因此，他也希望能透过陶艺为社会议题发声，走入更多人的内心世界。

title: A New Understanding of How Our Eyes Work
name: Stanley Tien
bio: Stanley Tien is a Neuro-Developmental and Behavioral Optometrist. He graduated from the University of Wales, UK, majoring in Optometry, before specializing in vision and neurological behavior development. He is Malaysia's only recipient of the Fellowship of the College of Optometrists in Vision Development (FCOVD), a national organization dedicated to vision development and vision therapy. As opposed to a typical optometrist, Tien's role as a visual development therapist involves analyzing and evaluating how vision impacts the daily activity of patients, while providing the necessary treatment to improve their quality of life by raising their functional vision.
introduction: Optical neurodevelopmental therapist Stanley Tien’s mission is to be the voice of our eyes and brain. Beside vision, our eyes are also responsible for 16 other different functions. Each function plays a key role in various situations, which is then processed by the brain to piece together the scene we see everyday. The impact and importance of vision on our lives are far greater than we usually expect. Through different examples, Tien explained the impact of visual and hearing impairment on daily life, allowing us a renewed understanding of the windows to our soul.

translations.title: 视觉，远不止一张视力表那么简单！
translations.name: 田统杰
translations.bio: 田统杰，视觉发展治疗师。毕业自英国威尔斯大学验光学系，而后专研视力与神经和行为发展的他，是大马唯一一位获得美国视光发展与视觉治疗委员会 (FCOVD) 认证的视觉发展治疗师。与一般的验光师不同，作为视觉发展治疗师，他擅长分析视觉对日常活动的影响， 再通过对病患的评估、治疗，从而提升功能性视力、改善病患的生活素质。治疗中，他透过创新和趣味的游戏，帮助患有自闭症、唐氏综合症和阅读障碍等的小朋友改善视觉障碍，以提升智力与肌肉功能的发展，是大马人民的视力守护者。
translations.introduction: 视觉神经发展治疗师田统杰的任务，是为不会说话的眼睛和大脑发声。关于我们的双眼，除了经常提及的“视力”以外，还有其它16项不同的功能。每一个功能都在不同的情况下发挥着各自的作用，再经过大脑的处理，拼凑出我们日常所见的画面。其实，视觉对我们生活的影响和重要性远远大于我们平常所认知的。田统杰透过不同的案例，带我们认识到了视觉障碍对日常生活，甚至是听觉的影响，重新开启认识灵魂之窗的大门。

title: Ternary Thinking: How do Malaysian Chinese Cope With the Current Crisis?
name: Tan Sri Andrew Sheng
occupation: Former Central Banker and Financial Regulator
bio: Tan Sri Andrew Sheng is an internationally renowned economist. He served at Bank Negara Malaysia from 1976 to 1989, at the World Bank from 1989 to 1993 as Senior Manager of Development, at the Hong Kong Monetary Authority as vice president from 1993 to 1998, and as Chairman of the Securities and Futures Commission from 1998 to 2005. He serves as Chief adviser to the China Banking Regulatory Commission Since 2006. He is the author of "From Asia to the Global Financial Crisis: An Asian Regulator's View of Unfettered Finance in the 1990s and 2000s" in 2009. He appeared in the 2011 Oscar-winning documentary film “Inside Job” and was named one of the 100 Most Influential People in the World by Time magazine in March 2013.
introduction: The chaos that is happening globally and locally has placed Malaysia in a crisis. In view of this, Tan Sri Andrew Sheng believes that we should use the three-valued logic thinking to analyze our own strengths and problems. From the perspective of timing, geography and people, East Asia and ASEAN region - where Malaysia is located - is currently the area with the fastest economic growth globally. Malaysia is blessed with abundant natural resources, and our multilingual ability plus cultural diversity also give us a great advantage in foreign markets. However, many young Malaysians today lack trust towards the country, the race, and themselves; i.e., we are short on the “people” aspect of the three factors. Hence, he emphasized that we need to have “faith” and “will” to overcome the crisis. Young Malaysians must allow themselves and their peers to have the trust they deserve, and convert that strong will into action. By being brave to take risks, be entrepreneurial and create value, only can we have the ability to advantageously align the three major factors - timing, geography, and people - in our favour.

translations.title: 三元思维: 大马华裔如何应对眼前危机？
translations.name: 沈联涛
translations.occupation: 前中央银行行长兼金融学家
translations.bio: 丹斯里沈联涛，国际知名经济学家。他先后在 1976 年至 1989 年在马来西亚中央银行任职，1989 年至 1993 年在世界银行担任发展部高级经理，1993 年至 1998 年任职香港金融管理局副总裁，1998 年至 2005 年担任证券及期货事务委员会主席，2006 年担任中国银行业监督管理委员会首席顾问至今。他在 2009 年出版了《从亚洲到全球金融危机：一个亚洲监管者对 1990 年代和 2000 年代不受约束的金融的看法》，在 2015 年担任《将影子银行带入光明：中国金融改革的机遇》的联合编辑。他是 2011 年奥斯卡获奖纪录片《监守自盗》的受访嘉宾，并于 2013 年 3 月被美国《时代》周刊选为年度“全球百名最具影响力人物”。
translations.introduction: 世界与国内局势的乱象置马来西亚于危机当中。面对危机，丹斯里沈联涛认为我们应用三元思维来分析自身的优势与问题。从天时，地利，人合，三个角度出发，他表示，大马处在的东亚和东盟地区正是现今全球经济增长最快的区域；得天独厚的大马也有着丰富的天然资源；语言与文化丰富的大马人也对占据国外市场有很大优势。但是，现况下许多大马年轻人却缺乏了对国家、种族和自己的信任，即我们缺了三元中的 “人合”。因此他强调，要克服危机，我们需要“信” 和“志”。大马年轻人必须给予自己和他人应有的信任 (信），再把强烈的意愿化为行动 （志），勇敢创业来创造价值，才有能力创造更优越的天时，地利和人合。

title: Conquering eSports Using “The Art of War”
name: Coach Stanley
occupation: Esports coach of Malaysia National team
bio: Coach Stanley is the esports coach of Malaysia National team. He was deeply moved by the Multiplayer Online Battle Arena (MOBA) by chance and decided to pursue esports professionally. His outstanding performance was recognized by the national team and world-renowned coaches Kitamura and Lu Yao. Less than a year after completing his training, he joined the national Sports Council (MSN) esports coaching team officially. Under his coaching, his team won various local and international championships consecutively, and he represented the national team at the 2022 SEA Games. With his strength, confidence, grapple skills, strategies and tactics, he has broken the stereotypes of esports as a "pseudo profession" or "harmful towards young people."
introduction: Esports is not merely a recreational activity, but a combination of sports and competitive gaming. Esports can be considered as a derivative of chess - it also follows Zermelo’s theorem - but in Esports, the permutation of possibilities far surpasses it. Originally a math and science tutor, Coach Stanley teamed up with his students to participate in an Esports tournament as a way to get along better with them. Facing a stronger opponent from a national level, they managed to withstand the pressure and turned the tables tactically, defeating their opponent to win the game. Since then, Coach Stanley has a renewed appreciation for Esports and acknowledged it as a remarkable mental challenge; not only it tests players’ ability to master strategy and tactics, but also logical thinking within a four-dimensional space. Now, as a national Esports coach, Coach Stanley dedicates himself to the industry and studies Sun Tzu’s “Art of War” diligently to continue improving himself as an outstanding mentor.

event.title: Reset
event.description:
A sudden infectious outbreak, the world was brought to an abrupt halt. When time seems to have stopped, it's about spending time on our own. Since we can’t travel abroad; let's open up and dive into our hearts.

Life is close at hand yet ephemeral; let’s cherish it while it lasts. We introspect and evaluate, followed by
overturn, then breakthrough; when time seems to stand still, we push the axle forward silently……

Once the “reset button” is pressed, step forward with your feet up. Instead of a lonely hesitation to start
from scratch, it's about changing your attitude and going all out.

Enduring hardship and toughening ourselves up; staying composed and shining bright alternately. Return to
where we begin and cultivate ourselves in the iteration. Just go against all odds, as time and tide wait for no man.

In the eyes are sun, moon, and stars, sometimes dark and sometimes bright, thus twinkle; in the heart, there are mountains and rivers, ups and downs in motion, thus immortal.

translations.title: 啟
translations.description:
一场突如其来的疫情，蓦然为世界按下“暂停键”，岁月看似停滞不前，实为容许更多和自己相处的时间。既出不了国门；我们打开心门，去深度探索吧！生命近在咫尺；却又转瞬即逝，就珍而重之吧！我们反思、审视;进而推翻、突破；于仿佛停驻的时光里，默默推动前进的轮轴。
“重启键”一触,举足迈步,
不是从零开始的孤独踟蹰,
而是换个姿态方式再全力以赴。
|
风雨洗礼，淬火磨炼；
沉淀有时，盛放有时。
迭代之中，归本深耕；
砥砺前行，莫负韶华。
|
眼里有日月星辰，忽明忽暗，因此闪烁；
心中载山川河流，高低起伏，所以不朽。

translations.title: 以孙子兵法纵横电竞
translations.name: 刘嘉诚
translations.occupation: 大马国家队电子竞技教练
translations.bio: 刘嘉诚，大马国家队电子竞技教练。大学毕业后投入教育界耕耘多年，一次机缘巧合下接触在线战术竞技游戏 (MOBA) 后深受打动，毅然走上电竞之路。在赛场表现出彩的他颇受国家队与国际著名教练北村胜宏与陆瑶的认同，短短一年内，完成受训后正式加入国家体育理事会 (MSN) 国家队的电子竞技教练团。不久后，他以电竞教练身份带领旗下团队，蝉联本地与国际赛事冠军，并于 2022 年代表国家队征战东南亚运动会。出身建筑系资优生的他，在电竞路上驰骋的过程中，凭借实力与自信，还有熟练的格斗技术、兵法谋略与战术，打破电竞被指认为“伪职业”或“游戏荼毒青年”的刻板印象。
translations.introduction: 电竞不单只是游戏，是竞技与博弈的结合。电竞也可以说是棋类游戏的衍生，同样遵循“策梅洛定律”，只不过电竞在变化的可能性上超越任何棋类游戏。起初，为了融入学生并了解他们的喜好，原本是数理科补习老师、现为国家电竞教练的刘嘉诚与学生组队参加电竞比赛。过程中，面对国家队出身的劲敌，他与队友在高压的情况下运用战术成功扭转劣势并赢得比赛。自此，他对电竞有了全新的认知，领略到电竞其实是一种极高的脑力挑战，考究的除了是玩家对兵法与战术的掌握能力，还有四维空间的思考逻辑。因此，热衷于挑战自我的他，毅然投入电竞行业，并刻苦研习《孙子兵法》，成为出色的国家队电竞教练。

title: The Flavology of Spices
name: Spices Tan
bio: Born in Penang, Spices Tan is the spices expert and narrator. She married and settled down in Taiwan. She was invited to Kaohsiung Community College by chance to conduct a course named "Southeast Asian Food Culture: Gastronomy". Her longing for the taste of home has triggered her to embark on the journey to trace the roots of the culture of spicy food. From Malaysia to India, China, Tanzania and other places, she explores and understands the characteristics of various spices, which also enable her to retrieve and interpret the native culture of peoples who cherish spices. Furthermore, by using spices as medium, she elevates spices to a higher level of cultural communication.
introduction: As a Malaysian, Spices Tan never paid too much attention to the myriad of spices used in the food she grew up having. It was until she experienced living abroad that sparked her curiosity about spices and kickstarted her journey to discover the roots of those aromas. Tan visited the places of origin of different spices around the world, immersing herself in collecting information and researching about their traits and temperament, while also seeking to interpret the native culture of spice cultivators. Using her familiar grasp of spices, Tan would often take apart their original compound and attempt to creatively reconstruct them to produce unique flavours.

translations.title: 香味调香师：创造食物风味密码
translations.name: 陈爱玲
translations.occupation: 东南亚饮食文化工作者
translations.bio: 陈爱玲，香料译述家。来自马来西亚槟城的陈爱玲，成为台湾媳妇后随丈夫到台湾定居。因缘之下，受邀到高雄社区大学开设“吃香喝辣聊东南亚文化”课程，加上思念家的味道，开启了她的辛香料饮食文化寻根之旅。走访到各国香料原乡深入钻研，从马来西亚到印度、中国、坦桑尼亚等地，探访香料，了解各种香料特质，也从中追溯及解读香料民族的原生文化。再者，陈爱玲独家研究，把香料复方拆开，堆叠料理的别样风味，更以辛香料为媒介，上升至更高的文化层面交流。
translations.introduction: 来自大马的香料译述家陈爱玲，从小吃的料理不离辛香料，却不曾在意过它，长大到外地生活的她，才开始对辛香料产生好奇，开启了她的辛香料饮食文化的寻根之旅。她到世界各香料原乡采集资料，深入钻研，了解它们的特质与脾性同时，从中解读香料民族的原生文化。有趣的是，摸透辛香料的陈爱玲，常把它们的原有复方拆开，创意重组，勾勒出料理的独家风味。

title: Forging a Future: The Return of the New Generations to Their New Village
name: Chili Ang Soon Chong
bio: Ang Soon Chong is a baking entrepreneur who grew up amidst the wafting fragrance of his family's bakery in Jenjarom, where they make kuih bahulu. Leveraging on his background in brand marketing and experience participating in the Dream Factory Startup Contest, Ang strives to carry forward his mother’s traditional baking craftsmanship with his sister. At the same time, he also engages in placemaking and community building at Jenjarom, hoping to steer the new village towards an economic transformation that creates value from tradition.
introduction: To baking entrepreneur Chili Ang, Chinese new villages are not merely a historical artifact nor popular weekend day trip destinations, but a place full of cultural treasures and opportunities. As part of the younger generation who grew up at Jenjarom new village, Ang formed the “Jenjarom gín-á” team with several like-minded friends out of appreciation for the place which nurtured them. By integrating local resources and injecting new elements into traditional industries, they hope to promote growth and development in the new village and enable it to keep up with the times - which, hopefully, will close the generation gap between the older and younger residents of the village.

translations.title: 新世代重回新村, 走出未来
translations.name: 洪顺忠
translations.bio: 洪顺忠，烘焙创业青年。成长于仁嘉隆幸福村一个手工鸡蛋糕飘香的家庭中，他凭借品牌营销的背景和参与圆梦工场创业大赛的经历，致力于和姐姐一起把妈妈的传统手艺发扬光大。同时，他也通过链接在地人，在仁嘉隆新村里探索地方创生和社区营造的可能，积极推动新村经济转型，从传统中再创新价值！
translations.introduction: 对烘焙创业青年洪顺忠而言，新村不只是历史产物，更不只是周末小旅行的好去处，而是蕴藏着无限宝藏且充满契机的地方。感恩于孕育自己成长的这片土地，身为仁加隆新村新一代的洪顺忠，与几位志同道合的友人组成了 “仁加隆 gín-á” 小队。他们希望通过整合新村的在地资源，拉近老一辈与新一代的距离，进而在传统产业中注入新元素，以期推动新村发展，并带领着新村与时俱进。

title: Can Creativity Reduce Waste?
name: Jeslyn Ooi
occupation: Founder and designer of Happy Dumpy
bio: Jeslyn Ooi Shiyun is the founder and designer of Happy Dumpy, a local brand of souvenirs inspired by Malaysian culture. As a child, Ooi has displayed a wealth of talent and creativity, having been involved in painting, music and dance. She described herself as a "creative soul who loves churning out fresh ideas", and believes that a good design should also be able to solve problems for the users. Through her motto "Creativity has the power to change the world", Ooi incorporates design thinking into everyday life to create beautifully designed gift ideas. Happy Dumpy's Malaysian food souvenir series is one of her signature creations, in which she hoped to convey the cultural stories behind Malaysian food while also emphasizing the importance of sustainable social and cultural development.
introduction: “As long as we feel the world with our hearts, think from various perspectives, and create new possibilities with innovation, we will have the ability to change the world.” Jeslyn Ooi is a creative designer and founder of Happy Dumpy who is adept at handicrafts. She likes to come up with fresh and interesting ideas, such as handmade souvenirs in the form of Malaysian food, collecting used cooking oil from mamak stalls to turn it into dishwashing liquid, designing an educational fishing game to increase children’s awareness towards ocean plastic pollution, and so on. By nurturing her seeds of kindness with creativity and ingenuity, Ooi sought to bring positive change to society - one small sprout at a time.

In the eyes are sun, moon, and stars, sometimes dark and sometimes bright, thus twinkle; in the heart, there are mountains and rivers, ups and downs in motion, thus immortal.

translations.title: Can Creativity Reduce Waste?
translations.name: Jeslyn Ooi
translations.occupation: Founder and designer of Happy Dumpy
translations.bio: Jeslyn Ooi Shiyun is the founder and designer of Happy Dumpy, a local brand of souvenirs inspired by Malaysian culture. As a child, Ooi has displayed a wealth of talent and creativity, having been involved in painting, music and dance. She described herself as a "creative soul who loves churning out fresh ideas", and believes that a good design should also be able to solve problems for the users. Through her motto "Creativity has the power to change the world", Ooi incorporates design thinking into everyday life to create beautifully designed gift ideas. Happy Dumpy's Malaysian food souvenir series is one of her signature creations, in which she hoped to convey the cultural stories behind Malaysian food while also emphasizing the importance of sustainable social and cultural development.
translations.introduction: “As long as we feel the world with our hearts, think from various perspectives, and create new possibilities with innovation, we will have the ability to change the world.” Jeslyn Ooi is a creative designer and founder of Happy Dumpy who is adept at handicrafts. She likes to come up with fresh and interesting ideas, such as handmade souvenirs in the form of Malaysian food, collecting used cooking oil from mamak stalls to turn it into dishwashing liquid, designing an educational fishing game to increase children’s awareness towards ocean plastic pollution, and so on. By nurturing her seeds of kindness with creativity and ingenuity, Ooi sought to bring positive change to society - one small sprout at a time.

translations.title: 创意如何减少垃圾？
translations.name: 黄诗韵
translations.occupation: Happy Dumpy 创办人兼设计师;
translations.bio: 黄诗韵，Happy Dumpy 创办人兼设计师。自小参与绘画、音乐、舞蹈等各类艺术活动的她，是个才华横溢且富有创造力的女生，总喜欢提出许多新鲜有趣的想法。她认为，一个好的设计作品不仅限于其美观的外表，还要实用且能帮助使用者解决问题。凭着“创意可以改变世界”的信念，她擅长将设计思维融入日常生活中，创造出设计精巧的礼品。Happy Dumpy 旗下的大马美食造型纪念品系列便是其代表作之一，以此向大众传递更多美食背后的文化故事，同时强调社会文化可持续发展的重要性。
translations.introduction: “只要我们用心感受世界，以各种角度思考，用创意创造新的可能，我们是有能力改变世界的。” Happy Dumpy 创办人兼设计师黄诗韵是个富有创造力的设计师，擅长手作，总喜欢提出许多新鲜有趣的想法 —— 手工制作大马美食造型的节日纪念品，让消费者可循环使用，以减少浪费；在嘛嘛档 (Mamak) 设置回收桶，收集回锅油并把它转变成洗碗液，以减少水源污染的问题；设计出具有教育性的钓鱼游戏，以让孩子们意识到海洋塑料污染的严重性……她从小小善意出发，运用创意与巧思，为社会带来了一点点改变。

title: Conscious Consumer
name: Jon Lee
occupation: Co-founder of natural health and skincare concept store Re{me}dy
bio: on Lee is passionate about sustainable practices. While participating in a beach cleanup activity with his previous company Rip Curl, he encountered appalling sights of beaches with unimaginable amounts of rubbish. Overcoming his shock and disbelief, Jon went on a soul searching journey which ended up with the co-founding of Re{me}dy, a natural health and skincare store, with his friends. Besides encouraging more people to use natural products, Re{me}dy aims to cultivate Conscious Consumers via three actions: Consider, Upcycle, and Learn. Jon hopes that the store will plant a seed of environmental protection in the hearts of consumers, which would then lead to them discovering their own ways of contributing, and practicing, towards a sustainable, environmental-friendly lifestyle.
introduction: “As consumers, we have so much power to change the world just by being careful in what we buy.” - Emma Watson                           Jon Lee, co-founder of natural health and skincare concept store Re{me}dy, resonated with this quote deeply. Besides implementing sustainable practices in his store, Lee sought to raise consumers’ awareness using education and also commit to promote upcycling.Unlike other retailers, Lee purposely hired “unretail” staff who do not push sales, and avoided running promotional activities in his store. He believes that to change people’s consumption habits, it is equally important to be a conscious retailer as well. While it is not easy to change consumerism and fast retail culture in a short time, Lee is ready to do his part one step at a time.

translations.title: 用零售推动理性消费
translations.name: 李添泉
translations.occupation:
天然健康与美容产品概念馆 Re{me}dy 
联合创始人
translations.bio: 李添泉，永续发展环保推动者。在曾任职的 Rip Curl 冲浪运动服品牌参与净滩活动里，看见多得让人眼花缭乱的垃圾后，当下对自己做了灵魂拷问。尔后决定与志同道合的友人联合创办天然健康与美容概念馆 Re{me}dy，并在馆内各处甚至产品成分里，贯彻环保的理念。除了鼓励人们使用天然产品之外，也希望通过思考、升级改造 (upcycle)、学习等，培养更多有意识的消费者，在他们心中埋下环保和永续发展的种子，并启发他们发现自己的环保潜力，在生活中自然地实践环保。
translations.introduction: “作为消费者，我们有很大的力量来改变世界，只要我们谨慎购买。” 天然健康与美容产品概念馆 Re{me}dy 创办人李添泉，对这句话深有感触。他除了在馆内贯彻可持续发展的理念，通过教育来提升消费者的消费意识，更是致力于推广升级改造 (upcycle) 的概念。与其他零售商不同，在经营 Re{me}dy 方面，李添泉专门聘请不会销售的人，而店内也从不做促销活动。他认为从消费源头着手，自己先开始当个有意识的零售商，也是至关重要的。消费文化和零售文化无法在短期内改变，但是却可以一步一步来。

title: Malaysia Cocoa From Tree to Bar
name: Ong Ning Geng
bio: Ong Ning Geng, the founder of Chocolate Concierge, the advocate and pioneer of the “tree-to-bar” chocolate. In 2009, Ong gave up his career as an app developer in the US and moved back to hometown Kepong in order to take care of his grandmother. Driven by an innate curiosity for flavours and origins, he eventually chose to focus on chocolate for its universal appeal, as well as the fact that it can be grown successfully in Malaysia. Committed to elevating and advancing Malaysian single-origin chocolate, Ong established himself as a high-quality chocolate-bar maker by venture into remote areas in cultivating cacao plants of various origins, before fermenting and processing the beans into chocolate.
introduction: Chocolate Concierge founder Ong Ning Geng is embarking on a lifelong journey to search for a local flavour that can represent Malaysia globally. He recalled tasting a cocoa fruit at an oil palm plantation when he was a child - its richness still lingered in his memory until today. However, why are most Malaysians so unfamiliar with cocoa fruits these days? To search for the taste in his memory, Ong signed up for a cocoa planting course organized by the Malaysian Cocoa Board. He also got to know the local aboriginal villagers where cocoa is grown and sought to learn about natural cocoa farming methods from them. The fertile soil in Malaysia is very suited for growing cocoa trees, and the original taste of the cocoa berries can be preserved using natural farming. Applying the knowledge he learnt, Ong started to dry cocoa beans at home, fermented them, and managed to recreate the flavour he had in his memory. He later purchased an orchard to produce pure, single-origin chocolate that is proudly Malaysian.

translations.title: 建立大马 Tree to Bar 可可品牌
translations.name: 王宁耿
translations.occupation:
巧克力生产公司 
Chocolate Concierge 创始人
translations.bio: 王宁耿，本地巧克力生产公司 Chocolate Concierge 创始人，也是“tree-to-bar” (从可可树到巧克力) 概念的倡导者与先行者。长期在美国生活的他，为了陪伴年迈的婆婆，在 2009 年毅然放下从事多年的应用程序开发工作，回到故乡吉隆坡甲洞开启新的事业。虽然长期从事与通讯和科技相关的工作，但他实际上对食品，特别是产地和发酵过程中的风味转变特别迷恋。回马后，他开始报读并从事与食品相关的各种行业。他发现巧克力具有普遍的吸引力，而且在马来西亚种植的成功率相当高。因此，他决定往巧克力产业深耕发展。从走入偏远地区挖掘可可树种植地、培育不同产地的可可树，再将可可豆发酵并加工成巧克力，他不辞劳苦默默耕耘，推动并实践马来西亚单一原产地巧克力。
translations.introduction: 本着对本土风味的热爱与执着，Chocolate Concierge 创办人王宁耿一路探索，不停寻找能代表马来西亚的世界级风味。他想起小时候在油棕园初尝的可可果，丰富的口感使他至今仍难以忘怀。然而，为何如今马来西亚人对可可果如此陌生？为了寻找记忆中的风味，王宁耿报名参加大马可可局举办的可可种植课程，认识种植可可树的原住民，并从他们身上习得自然农法。马来西亚的土壤非常适用于种植可可树，使用自然农法能够保存可可果的原滋原味。习得这种种植方式后，王宁耿在家中将可可豆晒干后进行发酵，成功寻获记忆中尝过的那一颗风味万种的巧克力。后来，他也购入一片园地，从可可树到巧克力的单元生产线，王宁耿成功制作纯粹的、属于马来西亚风味的巧克力。

title: Infinity Love & Gratitude
name: Chiron Yeng
bio: Chiron Yeng is a spiritual healer who has been providing physio-psycho-spiritual therapies to the wounded. Diagnosed with autoimmune disease at 8 which led to frequently relapsing atopic dermatitis, it has a drastic effect on Chiron’s daily life. At 16, he woke up to the truth that his health is his responsibility and set forth on a journey of self-healing. He sought out master healers and mentors of personal and planetary healing from diverse traditions globally. Finally, he began to gain control through a series of psychology, nature and subconscious therapies, which gradually led to his miraculous recovery at last. Chiron has found the remedy for the psychological dilemma, and he is hoping to accompany more wounded souls in the journey in understanding the message behind their painstaking suffering.

translations.bio: Chiron Yeng is a spiritual healer who has been providing physio-psycho-spiritual therapies to the wounded. Diagnosed with autoimmune disease at 8 which led to frequently relapsing atopic dermatitis, it has a drastic effect on Chiron’s daily life. At 16, he woke up to the truth that his health is his responsibility and set forth on a journey of self-healing. He sought out master healers and mentors of personal and planetary healing from diverse traditions globally. Finally, he began to gain control through a series of psychology, nature and subconscious therapies, which gradually led to his miraculous recovery at last. Chiron has found the remedy for the psychological dilemma, and he is hoping to accompany more wounded souls in the journey in understanding the message behind their painstaking suffering.

translations.title: 我的身心灵之旅：爱与感恩
translations.name: 邢益庭
translations.bio: 邢益庭，心灵治疗师。他帮助过许多身心灵伤病者，曾经也是位伤病者。他于 8 岁突然患上自身免疫性疾病，造成异位性皮肤炎，频繁发作的同时，长期用药的副作用也对他的日常生活造成严重的影响。困扰至 16 岁的他，决定到世界各地探访治疗大师、萨满、变革型领导等人，开始深度探索内心，正面迎战这场疾病。后来以潜意识，与大自然连接等疗法自我疗愈，慢慢奇迹式地康复，摆脱十几年来的伤病缠身。他找到了心理困局的出路，也期许能陪伴更多伤病者，理解病痛背后所要表达的讯息。
translations.introduction: 邢益庭，心灵治疗师。他于 8 岁突然患上自身免疫性疾病，造成异位性皮肤炎，长期用药的副作用也对他的日常生活造成严重的影响。困扰至 16 岁的他，决定到世界各地探访治疗大师、萨满、变革型领导等人，开始深度探索内心，正面迎战这场疾病。后来以潜意识，与大自然连接等疗法自我疗愈，慢慢奇迹式地康复。他找到了心理困局的出路，也期许能陪伴更多伤病者，理解病痛背后所要表达的讯息。

title:
Sing Till Our Hearts Echo 
世界级合唱团：歌唱民族美声
name: UiTM Chamber Choir
bio: UiTM (Universiti Teknologi MARA) Chamber Choir was formed in 2015 by one of the senior lecturers from the UiTM faculty of Music department, Dr. Masashi Kishimoto. The Choir is made up of 500 members consisting of music majors from the faculty of music itself. The winner of three gold medals of Copernicus International Choir Competition and Festival in Poland, the Choir has proudly brought the South East Asian folk songs into the limelight of the international arena. UiTM Chamber Choir will be performing exciting folk songs to audiences in the upcoming conference. The power of music will surely bring people closer together.
introduction: The UiTM Chamber Choir performed a repertoire of diverse songs, including folk songs from across Southeast Asia, the Mexican love song “Bésame Mucho”, and the timeless Chinese classic, “The Moon Represents My Heart”. Under the illumination of the stage lights and the percussions of the instruments, the Choir members delivered an immersive, captivating musical performance.

event.title: Reset
event.description:
A sudden infectious outbreak, the world was brought to an abrupt halt. When time seems to have stopped, it's about spending time on our own. Since we can’t travel abroad; let's open up and dive into our hearts.

Life is close at hand yet ephemeral; let’s cherish it while it lasts. We introspect and evaluate, followed by
overturn, then breakthrough; when time seems to stand still, we push the axle forward silently……

Once the “reset button” is pressed, step forward with your feet up. Instead of a lonely hesitation to start
from scratch, it's about changing your attitude and going all out.

Enduring hardship and toughening ourselves up; staying composed and shining bright alternately. Return to
where we begin and cultivate ourselves in the iteration. Just go against all odds, as time and tide wait for no man.

In the eyes are sun, moon, and stars, sometimes dark and sometimes bright, thus twinkle; in the heart, there are mountains and rivers, ups and downs in motion, thus immortal.

translations.title: 啟
translations.description:
一场突如其来的疫情，蓦然为世界按下“暂停键”，岁月看似停滞不前，实为容许更多和自己相处的时间。既出不了国门；我们打开心门，去深度探索吧！生命近在咫尺；却又转瞬即逝，就珍而重之吧！我们反思、审视;进而推翻、突破；于仿佛停驻的时光里，默默推动前进的轮轴。
“重启键”一触,举足迈步,
不是从零开始的孤独踟蹰,
而是换个姿态方式再全力以赴。
|
风雨洗礼，淬火磨炼；
沉淀有时，盛放有时。
迭代之中，归本深耕；
砥砺前行，莫负韶华。
|
眼里有日月星辰，忽明忽暗，因此闪烁；
心中载山川河流，高低起伏，所以不朽。

translations.title:
Sing Till Our Hearts Echo 
世界级合唱团：歌唱民族美声

translations.title:
Sing Till Our Hearts Echo 
世界级合唱团：歌唱民族美声
translations.name: UiTM 合唱团
translations.bio: UiTM 合唱团由来自日本，任教于马拉工艺大学音乐学院的高级讲师 Dr. Masashi Kishimoto 于 2015 年创办，拥有超过五百位就读音乐专业，对音乐充满热忱的团员。他们曾在波兰的国际合唱团大赛中为马来西亚挣得三面金牌的荣誉，将东南亚的民族歌谣带上了闪亮的国际舞台。UiTM 合唱团透过生动的编曲为观众呈现充满活力且具有民族文化特色的歌曲，借助音乐的力量与听众拉得更近。
translations.introduction: 在灯光的照耀下，在乐器的敲击中，和谐美妙的歌声响起，UiTM 合唱团为我们带来了一首又一首的歌曲。每一位成员独特的音色融合在一起，此起彼落，清脆动听，将整个空间布满了令人陶醉的歌声。演唱的曲目非常多元，包括多首具备东南亚风味的民族歌曲，同时也有墨西哥的经典情歌Bésame Mucho 和华语乐坛那永不过时的经典之作——《月亮代表我的心》。UiTM合唱团的演出简直让人沉浸于生动悦耳的音乐世界中啊！

title: Re:sonance
name:
手碟与贝斯演奏双人组 
HaBa
bio: Handpan and bass duet, HaBa, was formed in 2018 by musicians Kent Lee and Thong Yoong How with the purpose of exploring the possibilities of sound and ideas. In each of their musical endeavors, HaBa experiments and blends various digital materials with organic sound source, hoping to achieve a "self-balance" between music and the universe, thus bestowing a multi-dimensional meaning to sound. HaBa has represented Malaysia in Dance in Asia 2019 (Indonesia) and Dance in Asia 2020 (online performance); they also toured multiple universities in China with percussion band.
introduction: Apparently, pottery creations can not only be seen, but also be listened to! Handpan and bass duet, HaBa, used the handmade ceramic musical instruments created by sculptor James Seet to produce sounds with earthy and soulful harmony. It is worth mentioning that most ceramic instruments do not have the familiar “do re mi” scale, so it is up to the musicians to improvise using their own senses and feeling. Under HaBa’s creative interpretation, there are ethereal drums with changing rhythms, clear gurgling streams, and rustling sound of leaves in the wind. These sounds - natural, unpretentious, and crisp - provide a therapeutic listening experience.

translations.title: 与陶共声
translations.name:
手碟与贝斯演奏双人组 
HaBa
translations.bio: 手碟与贝斯演奏双人组 HaBa，由两位音乐人李河健与唐勇豪于 2018 年组成。HaBa 的成立旨在探索声音和思想的更多可能性，在每一次的音乐创作中，他们探索并融合不同的材料来进行演奏，希望能借此赋予声音更多元的定义，并找到音乐与宇宙之间的自我平衡。HaBa 曾代表马来西亚参与 Dance in Asia 2019 (印尼) 以及 Dance in Asia 2020 (线上演出)，也曾偕同打击乐团“觉奏感”到中国多个大城市的大学巡演及交流。2022 年，HaBa 与本地雕塑艺术家薛文杰联手展开跨界合作，举办了名为“共声 (Re:sonance)”的现场艺术演绎，用陶作乐器吹奏和敲击出空灵万变的大地之声。
translations.introduction: 陶艺品原来不只能看，还能“听”！手碟与贝斯双人组 (HaBa) 使用由薛文杰手工制作的陶乐器，演奏和敲击出大地与灵魂的唱和。值得一提的是，大部分的陶作乐器都没有人们所熟知的“do re mi”标准音阶，全凭演奏者跟着音乐和自我感官去自由发挥。而在 HaBa 的创意诠释下，有的是节奏多变的空灵鼓声、清澈的潺潺流水声、树叶在风中摇摆发出的沙沙声……这些宛如大自然的声音，朴实无华，清脆无染，疗愈人心。

title: Cybersecurity: Avoid Online Scams?
name: Fong Choong Fook
bio: Fong Choong Fook is a veteran Cyber Security expert. As the founder and CEO of cyber security services firm LGMS, Fong’s specialties are in information security, where he provides training and consultation using his vast theoretical and practical experience. Fong is generous in sharing his knowledge and experience with others on the subject of cyber security, and has contributed towards raising the public’s awareness by teaching simple and effective preventative measures. Fong was awarded the 2013 ASEAN Chief Information Security Officer (CSO) of the Year by the International Data Group (IDG), and the 2017 Cyber Security Professional of the Year by CyberSecurity Malaysia.
introduction: “As long as you are using a mobile phone, you will have a chance to run into a scammer.” Do you know what kinds of scams are common? Can you spot a scamming method? Why would someone fall victim to a scam? Through years of experience dealing with them, Fong Choong Fook, founder and CEO of cyber security services firm LGMS, dissects the various modus operandi scammers used and analyzes their behavior using various real cases. As an internet user, how might we handle scammers and reduce our chances of falling victim to them? Fong shares his top advice on different preventative measures with the hope that everyone can learn how to better protect themselves in the cyber world.

translations.title: 网络安全：如何防网络诈骗?
translations.name: 冯宗福
translations.bio: 冯宗福，资深网络安全专家。网络安全服务公司 LGMS 创办人兼首席执行员，擅长资讯保安培训和咨询，拥有丰富的理论和实战经验。曾获 2013 年 IDG 颁发的东盟首席信息安全员 (CSO) 和马来西亚网路安全机构年度网络安全专业人士奖项。多次为亚太、东欧、非洲地区的政府机构和客户，提供在信息系统安全方面的咨询服务以及训练方案，包括：企业风险矩阵图设计、方针实施的准确性、渗透测试等等。多年来在网络安全课题上，总是不吝分享自己的知识和经验，传授简单又有效的防范措施，在提升国人的网络安全意识方面贡献良多。
translations.introduction: “只要你有用手机，就有机会碰上诈骗分子。” 你了解普遍的诈骗有哪几种吗？你能识破诈骗的模式吗？为什么会成为诈骗受害者？网络安全服务公司 LGMS 创办人兼首席执行员冯宗福，通过多年来的实战经验，一步步拆解不同的诈骗模式，并以各种真实案例剖析诈骗分子的行为。身为网络使用者，我们可以如何应对？学习防范措施、掌握资讯、与时并进，同时抱持 “多问、多谈和多学习” 的态度，能大大降低我们成为网络诈骗受害者的风险。

title: Forest School: Discover the Beauty in Nature
name: Clement Wong
occupation: Founder of the first forest school "KL Steiner School" in Kuala Lumpur
bio: Clement Wong is the local senior architect who is also the founder of the first school with classrooms in the forest in Kuala Lumpur. Inspired by his wife later (a researcher in anthroposophy) coupled with his own rich experience in the construction industry, he realized the importance of "dialogue" between children and the natural ecosystem. Therefore, by referring to and adopting "Waldorf Education / Steiner Education", he started the first school with classrooms in the forest in Kuala Lumpur, emphasizing whole-person education as its core approach. Through imagination, creation and experience, the school aimed at stimulating children's learning in three aspects: willing, feeling and thinking, besides providing children with opportunities to associate with the natural environment while learning from nature.
introduction: Generally, the urban education system tends to nurture children to value utility over humanity, resulting in a lack of opportunity for children to come in contact with nature. Facing a reset post-pandemic, we have to think: is there a better education approach that can replace the older system? Clement Wong, founder of the KL Steiner School, observed from his daughter’s passion in learning cursive that for children to love learning, they have to first discover “beauty”; and Waldorf education (a.k.a. Steiner education) advocates a holistic style of learning that nurtures children about beauty and humanity. As an architect, Wong understood that the forest is harmonious and inclusive, which presents a variety of learning materials beneficial to the body and mind of children. Should one desires a holistic education integrated with nature, the best learning environment would be in a forest. Therefore, Wong established KL’s first forest school with the philosophy, “Let children be amazed by beauty, be moved by admiration, and be sincerely devoted to learning by inspiration.”

Enduring hardship and toughening ourselves up; staying composed and shining bright alternately. Return to
where we begin and cultivate ourselves in the iteration. Just go against all odds, as time and tide wait for no man.

In the eyes are sun, moon, and stars, sometimes dark and sometimes bright, thus twinkle; in the heart, there are mountains and rivers, ups and downs in motion, thus immortal.

心中载山川河流，高低起伏，所以不朽。

translations.title: Forest School: Discover the Beauty in Nature
translations.name: Clement Wong
translations.occupation: Founder of the first forest school "KL Steiner School" in Kuala Lumpur
translations.bio: Clement Wong is the local senior architect who is also the founder of the first school with classrooms in the forest in Kuala Lumpur. Inspired by his wife later (a researcher in anthroposophy) coupled with his own rich experience in the construction industry, he realized the importance of "dialogue" between children and the natural ecosystem. Therefore, by referring to and adopting "Waldorf Education / Steiner Education", he started the first school with classrooms in the forest in Kuala Lumpur, emphasizing whole-person education as its core approach. Through imagination, creation and experience, the school aimed at stimulating children's learning in three aspects: willing, feeling and thinking, besides providing children with opportunities to associate with the natural environment while learning from nature.
translations.introduction: Generally, the urban education system tends to nurture children to value utility over humanity, resulting in a lack of opportunity for children to come in contact with nature. Facing a reset post-pandemic, we have to think: is there a better education approach that can replace the older system? Clement Wong, founder of the KL Steiner School, observed from his daughter’s passion in learning cursive that for children to love learning, they have to first discover “beauty”; and Waldorf education (a.k.a. Steiner education) advocates a holistic style of learning that nurtures children about beauty and humanity. As an architect, Wong understood that the forest is harmonious and inclusive, which presents a variety of learning materials beneficial to the body and mind of children. Should one desires a holistic education integrated with nature, the best learning environment would be in a forest. Therefore, Wong established KL’s first forest school with the philosophy, “Let children be amazed by beauty, be moved by admiration, and be sincerely devoted to learning by inspiration.”

translations.title: 森林学校：在自然中发现“美”
translations.name: 黄晓斌
translations.occupation:
吉隆坡第一所森林学校 
KL Steiner School 的创始人
translations.bio: 黄晓斌，本地资深建筑师，也是吉隆坡第一所森林学校的创始人。当人生开始步入育儿阶段，与一般父母相仿，他为孩子的教育感到忧虑。他开始思考，什么样的教育体系对孩子才是最友善、最合适的？后来他在对人智学颇有研究的妻子身上获得启发，加上从事建筑行业多年积累的经验，他领略到孩子与自然生态系统“对话”的重要性。因此，他参考并借鉴国外流行多年的教育体系——“华德福教育”，在本地吉隆坡开办第一所以全人教育为核心的森林学校，通过想象、创造与体验的方式，激发孩童的 (学习) 意愿 (willing)、情感 (feeling) 以及思维 (thinking)，提供孩子回归大自然、并从大自然身上学习的机会。
translations.introduction: 一般的城市教育体系往往培育孩子看重功利而忽视人性，使孩子缺乏与大自然接触和沟通的机会。面对后疫情时代的重启，我们要重新思考，有什么更好的教育方式可以替代旧有的教育系统？吉隆坡华德福教育发起人黄晓斌从小女儿热衷学习英文草书上领悟到，要让孩子热爱学习，首先要让孩子发现“美”，而华德福所提倡的全人教育正是培养孩子美与人性的教育。在建筑行业驰骋多年的他也了解到，森林是和谐与包容的，孩子可以从中汲取各种有益身心的学习素材。如果要实现全人教育与大自然的结合，最好的学习环境就是森林。因此，黄晓斌在吉隆坡创办第一所森林学校，办校的理念如他所说：“让孩子因美丽而赞叹，因赞叹而感动，因感动而由衷地投入学习和奉献。”

title: Food Revolution: Avant Meats
name: Carrie Chan
bio: Carrie Chan is the co-founder and CEO of Avant, a cultivated meat company based in Hong Kong. Together with bioentrepreneur Dr. Mario Chin, they founded Avant in 2018, focusing on researching and producing cell-based functional protein which can be incorporated in food, cosmetics and other applications. The resulting product is hence entirely free from radiation, microplastics, heavy metals and other pollutants, while also reducing carbon emission and issues caused by overfishing. Avant was listed as one of the Technology Pioneers by the World Economic Forum in 2021, while Carrie was also featured on the 2022 Bloomberg New Economy Catalyst List.
introduction: Realizing the detrimental effects of meat production and transportation, such as high resource consumption and environmental pollution, Carrie Chan co-founded Avant, Asia’s first cell-cultivated meat company. Using biotechnology from 70 years ago without any genetic modification, Avant first extracted fish cells from the main body, which are then provided with the required nutrients and temperature in a bioreactor for half a month to develop into fish meat. Based on the process, cell-cultivated fish meat can be produced in a duration ten times faster than it took for a fish fry to mature; and selective cultivation, such as avoiding fish bones to be produced, is also possible - hence reducing waste. Looking forward to the future, Chan hopes to cultivate fish meat with combined muscle and fat, allowing a greater integration into diets across culture and preference.

translations.title: 饮食革命：细胞培植鱼肉
translations.name: 陈解颐
translations.occupation:
培植肉生物技术公司 Avant 
联合创办人兼首席执行官
translations.bio: 陈解颐，香港培植肉生物技术公司 Avant 联合创办人兼首席执行官。毕业自香港大学建筑系硕士班，而后获得世界顶尖欧洲工商管理学院 (INSEAD) 工商管理硕士学位的她，是一位充满热忱的环保主义者，常关注人类饮食对地球的影响。她和钱宝生博士于 2018 年共同创立了 Avant，主要研发和生产可用于食品、美妆产品和其他功能性用品的细胞培植鱼蛋白。培植鱼肉在过程中，直接利用鱼细胞制造营养丰富、高质量的鱼肉和功能性海洋蛋白质，避免了辐射、微塑胶、重金属等污染所致的食品安全问题，除了有助减低碳排放，也减少过度捕捞令海洋资源枯竭和破坏海洋生态。香港培植肉公司 Avant 因此于 2021 年获世界经济论坛 (The World Economic Forum) 评为“技术先锋” (Technology Pioneer)，陈解颐也在 2022 年荣誉彭博 (Bloomberg) 创新经济先行者。
translations.introduction: 在意识到肉类的饲养和运输需要耗费大量资源及造成环境污染的前提下，陈解颐与合伙人创立了亚洲首个细胞培植鱼肉公司。他们采用 70 年前的生物技术，没有涉及任何基因改造，将合适的鱼干细胞分离主体并给予所需的养分和温度，再放入生物反应器里半个月，像酿啤酒一般等待鱼肉的生成。根据流程，细胞培植鱼肉不仅能在比一般鱼苗短十倍的时间生成，更能针对性培植人类所需的肉类 (不培植骨头) 以减少浪费。放眼未来，陈解颐希望能培植出肌肉与脂肪结合的鱼肉，让培植鱼肉符合大家的饮食文化，融入各自的餐盘中。

title: Overcoming Life’s Ebb With Music
name: Aki
bio: A prolific singer-songwriter, Aki Huang began her career as the resident singer for Halo café in high school. At 19, she formed the female musical duo SukiMina with her friend Liu Mei Na, and released their first album: The Two People. In 2017, Aki made a comeback with her solo album “Hey”, she later formed the music band ARVAN with guitarist Gideon Alu8khan Chen and other musicians. After that, with social turmoil and insecurity as the theme, ARVAN released their first album named “Awakening”. Aki’s musical styles are described to be without boundaries, mixing and crossing musical genres, but most importantly, all of them are the genuine depiction of her life and feeling.
introduction: There will always be twists and turns in life, but as long as one bravely trudges the path, a different scenery awaits. Singer-songwriter Aki Huang’s life was turned upside down half a year ago, causing her to fall into a state of ebb and perplexity. At a point when everything felt disastrous, Aki decided that she would not continue to wallow in this slump. Being invited to speak in this event became her first step towards self-salvation, and she tried her best to hold on to the things she valued in life. Her daughters became her strongest spiritual support; her musical creations became her safe haven during times of vulnerability. Aki writes in all the joys and sorrows she experienced into her songs; her performance on stage, filled with warm notes and melody, filled every corner of the hall.

translations.title: 走出人生低潮，弹唱生命美好
translations.name: 黄淑惠
translations.bio: 黄淑惠，唱作女歌手。中学时期已在海螺民歌餐厅驻唱的她于 2000 年，年仅 19 岁时和音乐伙伴刘美娜以女生双人组合 SukiMina 出道，发行了第一张专辑《两个人》。该组合解散后，她在 2005 年以个人姿态发行了首张专辑《惠声绘色》，当中找来了张宇、游鸿明、蔡健雅等著名音乐人为她量身创作。2007 年起，她淡出流行乐坛舞台；热爱音乐的她在退居幕后的几年光景里仍活跃于歌曲创作，代表作包括田馥甄的《Love!》和杨丞琳的《过敏》。她在 2017 年带着个人全场做专辑《嘿》再次回归乐坛；随后与吉他手阿陆八 (Gideon Alu8khan Chen) 等音乐人组成 ARVAN 阿尔梵乐团，并发行了首张全创作专辑《我们不是都要沉睡》，作品内容书写着这个社会的躁动与不安。她的作品风格多元，每首作品都是她对生活和心情最真实的叙述。
translations.introduction: 人生这条路上，总有曲折和荆棘，但只要勇敢走下去，就会看见不一样的风景。Aki 黄淑惠的生活，在半年前发生了重大的改变，一度陷入低潮和迷茫之中。她不安，她哭泣……在一切看似非常糟糕的时候，她决定不再允许自己继续沉沦下去。这一场演讲的邀请，成了她自我救赎的第一步。她努力紧抓着生命中依旧拥有的美好，勇敢地直面生活，直面自己。她的女儿们，成了她最强大的精神支柱；她的音乐创作，成了她脆弱时的避风港。Aki 将生活中所有的喜怒哀乐投入进了歌曲的创作中并在舞台上演唱，将承载着温暖的音符和旋律，布满空间里的每一个角落。

title: Reimagining The Art of Acting
name: Dr. Deric Gan
bio: Dr. Deric Gan is a director, playwright, composer, set designer, as well as an acting and directing instructor. He is the first Malaysian to obtain a Ph.D. in Performance Art from the Central Academy of Drama in China. He has written 8 theatrical plays, choreographed and directed nearly 50 theatre productions locally and abroad, performed in 1,500 plays, and won the Best Director 7 times in the ADA Drama Awards. Besides theatre, Dr. Gan also directed the after-competition shows at the 2008 Beijing Olympics and the Opening Ceremony of the 2022 Hangzhou Asian Games. He was named one of the most influential directors by the Beijing Theatre Association in its 2022 list of “40 Years of Chinese Contemporary Small Theatre”.
introduction: “Acting originates from life. You’re not as far away from acting as you think you are.” Life itself is a perpetual performing act. Every moment is a wonderful performance, and everyone is an actor in the play - they are also the main characters in their own life story. From his many years of experience in the theatre industry, Dr. Deric Gan led us to reacquaint ourselves with acting, while subverting our understanding of what we know about performance.

event.title: Balance
event.description:
Back to track after reset.
Both personal and social recovery are ahead of us. We are more compelled than ever to pursue efficiency and achievement, as if in search of the by gone time with twofold effort...
Caught in between anxiety, stress and worries, life is like tramp over hill and dale, how swiftly time flies, are you happy within?
Body and mind are like memory cards, carrying all that we’ve been through; but in due time, clean-up and adjustment is inevitable, to restore and revive the forgotten beauty.
Life goes a long way, but is not the distance that matters; instead from ceaseless discovery and experience, seek balance inwardly, pry into innate genuine self, with a better attitude, keep pace with the times, iteratively interleaving.
Stay balance, be liberal to diversity in tune with contemporary consensus, go beyond duality, integratively reconcile opposing forces, innovatively reincarnate amidst disturbance, for the sake of concord and harmony.
The eternity of mundane world is not the concern, mastering mind-body balance always comes first, and is the key to perpetuity.

translations.title: 衡
translations.description:
重启之后回归正轨，彼此面临着
个人和社会复苏的挑战。
我们比从前更迫切追求高效和成就，
仿佛要把过去流逝的时光，
都双倍寻找回来……
焦虑、压力与患得患失之间，生活像翻山越岭，
时间走得快了，内心是否快乐？
身心如同储存卡，承载我们所经历的一切；
但适当时候，总得好好清理调整一遍，
才能重现美好。

生活漫漫远行，
却不在于走多长的路；而是从不断发现和经历，
寻觅内心平衡，窥探自己最真实一面，
再以更好的姿态，
与时俱进，迭代交织。
平衡思维，驱使时代理解并包容多元观点，
打破二元对立的局限，融汇相对之力，
于纷扰创新轮回，达到共融与和谐。
不困念尘世是否可得永恒，
更重要的是掌握身心平衡。
身心平衡，方为永恒。

translations.title: Reimagining The Art of Acting
translations.name: Dr. Deric Gan
translations.bio: Dr. Deric Gan is a director, playwright, composer, set designer, as well as an acting and directing instructor. He is the first Malaysian to obtain a Ph.D. in Performance Art from the Central Academy of Drama in China. He has written 8 theatrical plays, choreographed and directed nearly 50 theatre productions locally and abroad, performed in 1,500 plays, and won the Best Director 7 times in the ADA Drama Awards. Besides theatre, Dr. Gan also directed the after-competition shows at the 2008 Beijing Olympics and the Opening Ceremony of the 2022 Hangzhou Asian Games. He was named one of the most influential directors by the Beijing Theatre Association in its 2022 list of “40 Years of Chinese Contemporary Small Theatre”.
translations.introduction: “Acting originates from life. You’re not as far away from acting as you think you are.” Life itself is a perpetual performing act. Every moment is a wonderful performance, and everyone is an actor in the play - they are also the main characters in their own life story. From his many years of experience in the theatre industry, Dr. Deric Gan led us to reacquaint ourselves with acting, while subverting our understanding of what we know about performance.

translations.title: 生活表演学：重新认识表演
translations.name: 颜永祺博士
translations.bio: 颜永祺博士，资深戏剧导演、新纪元大学学院博士生导师，也是木卡空间艺术总监。他是首位在中国获得戏剧博士学位的马来西亚人，迄今出版了 8 本戏剧著作。他在国内外编导近 50 部戏剧作品，演出场次多达 1500 场，获得7次马来西亚戏剧奖项的最佳导演。除了戏剧，他也担任中国诸多大型文旅演出的戏剧导演，也是 2008 年北京奥运会的体育展示导演和 2022 年杭州亚运会开幕式的戏剧导演。2022 年，被北京戏剧家协会等权威机构评为“中国当代小剧场戏剧 40 年”最具影响力导演之一。
translations.introduction: “表演来自生活。你和表演的距离，并没有想象中遥远。” 生活就是一场不断上演的戏剧，每一刻都是精彩的演出，每个人都是这出戏中的演员，也是自己生命故事的主角。凭着多年在戏剧界的丰富经验，颜永祺博士将带领我们重新认识表演，同时颠覆你对表演的认知。

title: How to Solve the Food Crisis?
name: Dr. Charles Fang Chin Cheng
occupation: Group CEO cum CFO of a local food-tech and multigrain company
bio: Dr. Charles Fang Chin Cheng is the Group CEO cum CFO of a local food-tech and multigrain company. He has more than 10 years’ experience with the United Nations Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO) as an Actuarial Advisor and was also the lead Economic Affairs Advisor to Oman’s Vice-Minister of Commerce, Industry, and Investment Promotion. He assisted 7 countries in Central Asia and Africa in formulating key national strategies and policies to achieve sustainable industrial development. Dr. Charles holds a Ph.D. in Banking and Finance from the University of New South Wales, Australia. He is devoted to tackling the global food crisis through food science and technology, and bringing positive environmental impacts to the local population and the world community.
introduction: Dr. Charles Fang Chin Cheng witnessed malnourishment through his work with the United Nations and was moved by what he saw; as he shared today, this has strengthened his resolve to promote food technology and make basic nutrition universally accessible. This mission requires all of us to work together, to solve the thorny issues surrounding global climate change and food security.

event.title: Balance
event.description:
Back to track after reset.
Both personal and social recovery are ahead of us. We are more compelled than ever to pursue efficiency and achievement, as if in search of the by gone time with twofold effort...
Caught in between anxiety, stress and worries, life is like tramp over hill and dale, how swiftly time flies, are you happy within?
Body and mind are like memory cards, carrying all that we’ve been through; but in due time, clean-up and adjustment is inevitable, to restore and revive the forgotten beauty.
Life goes a long way, but is not the distance that matters; instead from ceaseless discovery and experience, seek balance inwardly, pry into innate genuine self, with a better attitude, keep pace with the times, iteratively interleaving.
Stay balance, be liberal to diversity in tune with contemporary consensus, go beyond duality, integratively reconcile opposing forces, innovatively reincarnate amidst disturbance, for the sake of concord and harmony.
The eternity of mundane world is not the concern, mastering mind-body balance always comes first, and is the key to perpetuity.

身心如同储存卡，承载我们所经历的一切；

与时俱进，迭代交织。

身心平衡，方为永恒。

translations.title: 如何解决粮食危机？
translations.name: 章芳俊博士
translations.occupation: 食品公司总执行长兼财务官
translations.bio: 章芳俊博士，食品公司总执行长兼财务官。他曾任联合国工业政策与经济统筹精算顾问、阿曼商务工业投资部副部长总经济事务专员等职 10 年，协助中亚及非洲 7 国策划国家重点工业战略与政策，以实现可持续工业发展。他在澳洲莫纳什大学商学院考获会计、经济与商务精算统计本科学士学位， 22 岁获颁澳洲新南威尔士大学国际研究生国家奖项深造银行与金融博士学位，目前是北京大学新结构经济学研究院的研究员。他希望能借由食品科技，解决世界粮食危机。
translations.introduction: 曾在联合国工作的章芳俊见过营养不良的小孩，这触动了他的内心，更坚定了他推动食品科技，为人类带来可负担营养的使命。这份使命需要每个人共同推进，以解决迫在眉睫的世界候变迁和粮食问题。

title: Limitless Creativity: Exploring Design & Thinking
name: Clu Soh
bio: Clu Soh is the founder and product designer of Exping, a mobile app to create personalised maps. A designer-turned-entrepreneur who has been based in Guangzhou, China for 7 years, Clu is inspired by tech company Apple to change the world through design, which led him on the path of application product design. Clu was involved in the creation of the SEA Games app and the service design of a roaming company for their frequent flyer customers. His portfolio also includes smart shopping carts, smart retail solutions, and he even has 6 design invention patents. Clu is adept at transforming minute observations into design solutions and believes that one can change the world through the creation of beautiful designs.
introduction: Clu Soh is a creative and visionary designer who dreams of creation and connection. His goal is to break down traditional boundaries by fusing different cultures and elements together, thus creating a new product. For instance, by reviewing the pain points of supermarket shopping and searching for similar user-friendly cases in life, Clu designed smart shopping carts to optimise the shopping experience of customers. He brings creativity to practical, applied products and believes that beautiful design can change the world. He shared with us his creation process and how he sees observation, exploration and practice.

translations.title: 创造无限：探索设计与思考
translations.name: 苏维佳
translations.bio: 苏维佳，从一名创作者，成为现今创业者。已居中国广州 7 年，过去是一名平面设计师，如今是 Exping (地图创作工具) 的创始人兼产品设计师。在受国际品牌 “Apple 苹果” 启发下，希望透过设计去改变世界。因此转向应用产品设计之路，曾参与设计东南亚运会应用以及为全球常旅客服务的漫游服务设计，并设计了智能购物车，智慧零售等方案，目前已有 6 个设计发明专利。擅于从微小的事物挖掘，并将其转化为设计方案，再把创意融入实用的应用产品中。相信通过创造美好的事物，可以改变世界。从探索到体验，最终将创造的成果呈现给这个世界。
translations.introduction: 苏维佳，一位充满创意和远见的设计师，将创造与连接视为他的梦想。他的目标是打破传统界限，将不同文化和元素融合在一起，创造出新产品。比如：透过回顾超市购物的痛点，寻找生活中相似的友好体验而设计出智能购物车，借此优化顾客的购物体验。他将创造力融入实用的应用产品中，相信美好的设计可以改变世界。他将与我们分享他的创造之路，以及他如何看待观察、探索和实践。期待一同探索这个独特的品味世界。

title: The Ingenuity of Intercultural Communication
name: Loh Wei Hoong
bio: Loh Wei Hoong is a Corporate Coach and Chair at Vistage, the world’s largest executive coaching organization for small and midsize businesses. He graduated with an MA in Economics from Dalhousie University, Canada. Having worked at KPMG as a Marketing Director, Wei Hoong also has extensive industry experience with listed companies and financial firms, where he was involved in petrochemicals, telecommunications, and investment projects. Wei Hoong has also contributed to the Penang government, which he improved its strategic management capabilities and enhanced the reforms of the local education system. He was awarded the PKT (Pingat Kelakuan Terpuji) Medal of Commendation in 2010 by the Penang government for his effort.
introduction: Being multilingual and multicultural is an especially important skill to Loh Wei Hoong. So is knowing how to navigate countries and situations all over the world, and adjusting his lectures and lecturing styles toward different entrepreneurs as necessary. His experience across the world has convinced him that multiculturalism is especially precious. Not only is Malaysia all the more unique because of this – it also affords us rare opportunities when facing situations abroad. Unlocking and mastering this emerging global trend of cross-culturalism is a critical lesson for all of us to learn.

translations.title: 跨文化交流的诀窍
translations.name: 罗炜雄
translations.bio: 罗炜雄，伟事达私董会企业总裁导师。他毕业于加拿大戴尔豪斯大学经济学学士和硕士学位。曾任著名会计事务所毕马威 (KPMG)的营销总监，也曾在上市集团和金融公司负责石油化工、电信、投资融资等项目。 现担任多家商学院的工商管理学客座教授。他强调学以致用和生动教学，培养许多卓越的企业领导者。 同时也对槟城政府官员战略管理能力提升做出贡献，提升当地教育体系改革和其市场思维，因此在 2010 年获得槟城政府的品行褒扬的勋衔。
translations.introduction: 掌握多元语言和文化的罗炜雄，能游刃有余地顺应不同的国情，灵活调整内容和说法方式为企业家授课，这是其一大特色。周游各国多年的他领悟多元文化是一块宝藏，不仅使马来西亚在世界占有一席之地，更是面对世界局势的良好契机。如何发掘和掌握跨文化，是未来的大趋势，也是大家需要关注的课题。

title: Things You Haven’t Think of About Death
name: Dr. Tan Ran Zhi
bio:
Dr. Tan Ran Zhi is the Deputy Director of Sungai Buloh Hospital’s Department of Forensic Medicine. With over 10 years of experience in forensic science, Dr. Tan has autopsied more than a thousand bodies, providing valuable evidence for justice.

Dr. Tan has also been invited to speak on the topic of forensic science on radio stations, given interviews in media, written about it in blogs and columns, and even organised forensic science courses. He aims to educate the public about the complexity and importance of forensic science and to dispel the misconceptions about autopsy via multiple platforms. Dr. Tan hopes to raise society’s awareness about the field of forensic science and encourage more participation and support in this field to ensure justice and enforcement of the law.
introduction: “Dissecting a body isn’t as scary as we thought.” Dr. Tan Ran Zhi has over 10 years of experience in forensic science. He has autopsied more than 1,000 bodies, providing valuable evidence for justice. Not only is Dr. Tan passionate about his job, but he is also enthusiastic to share his knowledge in forensic science, hoping that the community can learn more about the importance of this field.
