translations.title: Things You Haven’t Think of About Death
translations.name: Dr. Tan Ran Zhi
translations.bio:
Dr. Tan Ran Zhi is the Deputy Director of Sungai Buloh Hospital’s Department of Forensic Medicine. With over 10 years of experience in forensic science, Dr. Tan has autopsied more than a thousand bodies, providing valuable evidence for justice.

Dr. Tan has also been invited to speak on the topic of forensic science on radio stations, given interviews in media, written about it in blogs and columns, and even organised forensic science courses. He aims to educate the public about the complexity and importance of forensic science and to dispel the misconceptions about autopsy via multiple platforms. Dr. Tan hopes to raise society’s awareness about the field of forensic science and encourage more participation and support in this field to ensure justice and enforcement of the law.
translations.introduction: “Dissecting a body isn’t as scary as we thought.” Dr. Tan Ran Zhi has over 10 years of experience in forensic science. He has autopsied more than 1,000 bodies, providing valuable evidence for justice. Not only is Dr. Tan passionate about his job, but he is also enthusiastic to share his knowledge in forensic science, hoping that the community can learn more about the importance of this field.

translations.title: 关于死亡你没想过的事
translations.name: 陈然致法医
translations.bio: 陈然致法医，马来西亚雪州双溪毛糯医院法医部的副主任。他积累了超过 10 年的法医学工作经验，已经解剖了超过千具遗体，为司法提供了宝贵的证据。为了普及化法医学知识，他撰写博客、专栏、接受媒体访问、甚至开课等，让更多人了解法医工作的复杂性和重要性，并消除对解剖学的误解。他希望提高社会对法医学领域的认识，鼓励更多人积极参与和支持这一关键领域的工作，以确保公正地执行法律。
translations.introduction: “解剖遗体没有我们想象中恐怖。” 法医陈然致拥有超过十年的法医学经验。他的解剖刀为逝者揭开了许多真相，为法庭提供证据。年轻有理想的他，不仅热衷于他的工作，也乐于分享法医学知识。他希望社会能了解法医学的重要性。

title: Reimagining Life
name: Yusuf Hashim
occupation: Global Explorer, Author, and Freelance Adventure Photographer
bio: 77-year-old Yusuf Hashim is a global explorer, author, and freelance adventure photographer. He was the Managing Director at Shell Chemicals, where he worked for 32 years before electing to retire in 1999 at the tender age of 53. Since then, he has gradually checked off items on his bucket list, including driving across 120 countries on 6 continents; sailing to Antarctica 7 times, and becoming the oldest person to obtain a paramotor flying qualification at 68. Yusuf proved that age is not a hindrance to achieving goals. His adventurous spirit and desire to continue learning make him an exemplar to the younger generation.
introduction: How would you plan to spend your life? Yusuf Hashim spent the first half of his life excelling at his field, in the upper echelons of the petroleum industry. He chose to retire at 53 and spend his later years exploring the natural world through photography, travelling across six continents and over 120 nations, including 6 visits to Antarctica. His message for us is that time and life are priceless– it is vital for us to explore all the potential that life has to offer.

translations.title: 重新构思你的人生
translations.name: Yusuf Hashim
translations.bio: Yusuf Hashim，77 岁的探险家、作家兼摄影人。他曾在世界第二大的石油公司 Shell 服务长达 32 年，最后的职位是董事经理一职。 然而在 1999 年，53 岁的他决定提早退休追寻他的第二人生。他开车横跨地球，穿越 6 大洲超过 120 个国家，曾 7 次航行到南极洲，他 68 岁时取得了飞行脚踏滑翔伞的资格，成为最年长的脚踏滑翔伞飞行员之一。他用自己的行动证明了年龄并不是限制，其冒险、创新和学习的精神是后辈的典范。
translations.introduction: 你会怎么规划你的人生？Yusuf Hashim 的人生上半场，他是职场精英，石油公司的高层。人生下半场，他选择在 53 岁以后退休，看高山和大海，学摄影。已过不惑之年的他，开车横跨地球，穿越 6 大洲超过 120 个国家，6次航行到南极洲。他用他的生命告诉我们，生命无价，尽情去探索生命的更多可能。

title: Listening to the Sound of Nature
name: Yii Kah Hoe
bio: Yii Kah Hoe is a renowned composer from Malaysia. His music has gained wide recognition across Asia, the United States, and Europe, establishing him as an exceptional artist. He has served as a short-term visiting professor for the Claremont Colleges consortium in the United States and was invited as a short-term visiting scholar by the Birmingham Conservatoire, UK in 2013 and 2014. Yii Kah Hoe is also a Fulbright Scholar in Residence at Washington State University in the United States, where he conducted research and created soundscapes blending natural elements to raise awareness about environmental conservation. His music is considered bold and avant-garde, using the sounds and rhythms of many traditional instruments from different ethnic cultures.
introduction: “As long as you quiet your mind and listen, you will hear nature speaking to you. Soundscaper and composer Yii Kah Hoe used various traditional instruments from different ethnic cultures in a unique way to transform the sounds of the surrounding fields into beautiful melodies, creating distinctive musical compositions. This not only showcased his reverence for nature but also left an imprint of his passion for music and life. Listen to Yii Kah Hoe as he shared the secrets of turning sound into music. Join him on a journey into the wondrous world of soundscapes and experience the healing power of music and nature.

translations.title: 聆听大自然声音
translations.name: 余家和
translations.bio: 余家和，马来西亚著名作曲家。他的音乐被认为是大胆且前卫的，他的作品在亚洲、美国和欧洲广泛流传。曾任美国克莱蒙学院 (Claremont Colleges) 联盟的短期特聘教授，2013 与 2014 年被英国伯明翰音乐学院邀请做短期访问的学者，现为梳邦再也世纪学院的音乐系高级讲师。他曾是富布莱特驻校学者 (Fulbright Scholar) 奖助计划的学者，到美国华盛顿州立大学进行研究，并制作结合自然元素的声音景观，希望增强人类对环境保护的意识。
translations.introduction: “只要静下心聆听，你就会听到大自然与你对话。” 声景录音师兼作曲家余家和使用不同民族的传统乐器，将田野的声音转化为美妙旋律。他创作别具一格的音乐作品。这既是他对大自然表达敬意的方式，也是他热爱音乐和生活的印记。聆听余家和分享如何把声音变成音乐的窍门，并随他踏入声音景观的奇妙世界里，感受音乐与大自然的疗愈力。

title: Taking it Easy with Bossa Nova
name: Z Yan
bio: Z Yan is a Malaysian female singer. She possesses a mature and sensual vocal style, which she honed by performing at folk music restaurants in the late 90s, eventually releasing her first Mando pop album Xinyuan (Wishes) in 2007. Although she started as a pop singer, she eventually discovered her true passion in Jazz and Bossa Nova. As a result, she became the first Chinese singer to blend Bossa Nova into Mandarin pop music, earning her the title of “Bossa Princess”.
introduction: Z Yan is an avid fan of jazz music and is particularly passionate about the Bossa Nova style originating from Brazil. Having performed Bossa Nova songs multiple times, her dedication to promoting Bossa Nova in Malaysia earned her the title of “Bossa Princess”. Her enchanting voice, coupled with the laid-back and captivating Bossa Nova style, transports listeners to the distant lands of Brazil without them even realising it.

translations.title: 芭莎诺瓦的慢活路
translations.name: 欣彦
translations.bio: 欣彦，马来西亚女歌手。她声线纯熟且感性，90 年代末她在民歌餐厅驻唱，2007 年发行了个人第一张华语流行专辑《心愿》。虽然她始于流行乐，但后来她发现她最爱爵士乐和芭莎诺瓦 (Bossa Nova)。因此，她成为了第一个将芭莎诺瓦曲风结合于中文流行乐的女歌手，拥有 “芭莎公主” 美称。
translations.introduction: 欣彦喜爱爵士音乐，热衷于来自巴西的芭莎诺瓦曲风。她多次演绎芭莎诺瓦曲风的歌曲，努力在马来西亚推动芭莎诺瓦，因此享有 “芭莎公主” 的称号。她的歌声动人，配上曲风慵懒迷人的芭莎诺瓦，让人不知不觉间去到了遥远的巴西。

title: The Perseverance and Production of Music
name: Stefano Chen
bio: Stefano Chen is a professional opera tenor, vocalist, vocal coach, vocal producer and music producer based in Malaysia. His impeccable versatility has made him an outstanding artist in the country. Stefano was trained at the Beijing Central Conservatory of Music and the China National Opera House, where he learned from among the best tenors in China. Whilst in China, Stefano became recognised as the first male vocalist to record and produce a one-of-a-kind jazz album, Bop Within. This non-classical piece on his musical repertoire gained rave reviews from the Chinese media in 2000. In 2002, Stefano also assisted China’s television station, CCTV, in producing a promotional music album featuring Chinese and English songs for the 2008 Beijing Olympic Games Bidding campaign. He has been the vocal producer for renowned local and overseas singers, as well as the producer for more than ten world-class hi-fi albums for audiophiles. Now back in Malaysia, Stefano is committed to promoting Malaysian classical music through teaching, performance and production.
introduction: Through vocal music, Stefano sings the soul of Malaysia, while expressing his personal stories of this country. His powerful voice transcends time and location, inadvertently bringing audiences beyond boundaries and transporting us to a different era and region subconsciously. Stefano’s performance is a delightful feast of the senses that is timelessly memorable.

translations.title: The Perseverance and Production of Music
translations.name: Stefano Chen
translations.bio: Stefano Chen is a professional opera tenor, vocalist, vocal coach, vocal producer and music producer based in Malaysia. His impeccable versatility has made him an outstanding artist in the country. Stefano was trained at the Beijing Central Conservatory of Music and the China National Opera House, where he learned from among the best tenors in China. Whilst in China, Stefano became recognised as the first male vocalist to record and produce a one-of-a-kind jazz album, Bop Within. This non-classical piece on his musical repertoire gained rave reviews from the Chinese media in 2000. In 2002, Stefano also assisted China’s television station, CCTV, in producing a promotional music album featuring Chinese and English songs for the 2008 Beijing Olympic Games Bidding campaign. He has been the vocal producer for renowned local and overseas singers, as well as the producer for more than ten world-class hi-fi albums for audiophiles. Now back in Malaysia, Stefano is committed to promoting Malaysian classical music through teaching, performance and production.
translations.introduction: Through vocal music, Stefano sings the soul of Malaysia, while expressing his personal stories of this country. His powerful voice transcends time and location, inadvertently bringing audiences beyond boundaries and transporting us to a different era and region subconsciously. Stefano’s performance is a delightful feast of the senses that is timelessly memorable.

translations.title: 音乐的执着与制作
translations.name: 陈颖豪
translations.bio: 陈颖豪，马来西亚著名声乐导师、配唱制作人、男高音兼音乐制作人。他在多重角色中的卓越表现，使他成为马来西亚音乐领域的杰出代表。他在中国北京中央音乐学院与中央歌剧院学习声乐多年，也在北京办过几场独唱音乐会。他曾受邀指导国内外多位著名歌手的专辑配唱工作，并曾制作及策划超过十张蜚声国际的高端发烧人声专辑，因此被誉为最懂人声的配唱制作人。他曾制作的专辑包括《神秘之歌》等。此外，他也致力推广马来西亚古典音乐，参与不少音乐座谈会，通过教学、演出和制作等多种途径，推动着音乐文化的传承与发展。
translations.introduction: 陈颖豪透过声乐，演唱属于马来西亚的歌声，歌唱他和马来西亚的故事。他雄浑的歌声，总能让听众不知不觉间瞬移到不同时代、不同区域。他的演唱，是场让人回味无穷的听觉盛宴。

title: Textile Stories for Life Balance
name: John Ang
bio: John Ang is a collector of Malay textiles. He holds a Master’s degree in the History of Chinese Art from the University of Michigan. He initially worked as an art reporter for the Japan Times and later established an art gallery in Taiwan, where he spent nearly 30 years, gaining profound knowledge of Asian art. In 2013, during a visit to Bali, he first encountered Malay textiles, which sparked his curiosity and interest. He was deeply impressed by the beautiful culture associated with them. The following year, he began collecting Malay textiles and has since amassed over 5,000 pieces. In July 2022, he invested 1 million Malaysian Ringgit to organise the Malay World Textile Exhibition in Kuala Lumpur, showcasing over 700 valuable textiles representing 12 different techniques.
introduction: In 2013, after his encounter with Malay textiles on the Indonesian island of Bali, John Ang embarked on a journey of exploration and collection. With his deep knowledge of Asian art, he began to assemble and refine the cultural artefacts related to Malay textiles, documenting and enhancing their developmental history. At the same time, he organised the Malay World Textile Exhibition, aiming to increase the awareness of Malaysians regarding this field. During the event, John Ang shared his insights into his collection, using Malay textiles to take you on a journey of exploring diverse cultures, encouraging everyone to become truly diverse Malaysians. Cloth is not just the clothing we wear, but also embodies the wisdom and cultural diversity of our many ethnic groups.

translations.title: 传统纺织品中的身份探索
translations.name: 洪光明
translations.bio: 洪光明，马来纺织品收藏家。他毕业于美国密西根大学中国艺术史硕士，他先于《日本时报》负责艺术报道，尔后在台湾成立了艺术馆近 30 年，深谙亚洲艺术。他在 2013 年于峇厘岛初次接触马来纺织品，引起好奇和兴趣，更为其美丽文化折服，次年开始收购马来纺织品，至今收藏逾 5千件。他耗资 100 万令吉，在 2022 年 7 月于吉隆坡举办马来世界织品展，展出 12 种不同工艺的马来纺织品，以及 700 多件珍贵织品，引起极大回响。
translations.introduction: 2013 年，洪光明在印尼巴厘岛接触马来纺织品后，展开了探索和收藏之旅。深谙亚洲艺术的他，惊觉当代鲜少文字记载这些繁华多姿的马来纺织品，而开始集结与完善马来纺织品的文物，梳理与完善其发展足迹，同时举办马来世界织品展，期望能提高国人对这方面的认识，并将其推广至国际社会。在年会上，洪光明分享其收藏心得与那些 “被忘却” 的联系，以马来纺织品带你探索多元文化。布，不仅仅是我们身上穿着的服装，它还集结了各族群的智慧与人文风貌。

title: Who are the Indigenous People of Malay Peninsula?
name: Kuik Yi Ke
bio:
Kuik Yi Ke is a freelance journalist and photographer. She is currently a graduate student at the Department of Anthropology at National Taiwan University. She was also shortlisted for the “Excellence in Reporting on Human Rights” category at the 2021 SOPA Awards organised by the Society of Publishers in Asia. Yi Ke was formerly a video journalist and studio director at Astro TV Station, a prominent content and entertainment company in Malaysia. 

Yi Ke is an intrepid explorer of Malaysia’s natural wonders. She has explored numerous remote mountains and forests across the Malay Peninsula. Her mission is to document their lives, experience their way of life, and preserve their voices and images.
introduction: “Many people think indigenous education is backward, but in reality, it’s us city folks who have the most to be ashamed of.” As an adventurous individual from the post-90s generation, Kuik Yi Ke shared how she was dedicated to showcasing the lives of indigenous people to the world. She fearlessly ventured into the deep mountains and lush forests of the Malay Peninsula, forming friendships with indigenous communities, even enduring encounters with leeches, in her quest to document the lives of these indigenous people. Her goal goes beyond merely experiencing their way of life; it’s about capturing their voices and images so that more people can come to understand these friends who reside between the forests and mountains, seemingly distant but deeply interconnected with us. For Yi Ke, stepping into the world of the indigenous people and witnessing their diverse faces and beliefs reveals the true essence of Malaysia. It prompts urban residents to reconsider their own way of existence. Only by exploring the world of indigenous people can we unveil the authentic Malaysia.

translations.title: 马来半岛原住民是谁？
translations.name: 郭于珂
translations.bio: 郭于珂，自由记者兼摄影师，毕业于台湾政治大学新闻系，目前是台大人类学所研究生。她曾获得星洲日报《花踪文学奖》报告文学评审奖，曾入围亚洲出版业协会 (SOPA AWARD) 2021 年“卓越人权报道奖”。其摄影作品曾在台北国际摄影艺术交流展展出。她也曾担任电视台记者兼棚内导播。她把自己形容为一个生在钢骨森林，却心系热带雨林的女子，至今已勇闯马来半岛多座深山野林，喜欢与原住民为友、水蛭为伍，只为记录原住民的生活，体验原住民的生活方式，并致力于记录他们的声音和形象，让更多人知道，在森里与山河之间，住了一群看似遥远却与我们唇齿相依的朋友。
translations.introduction: “很多人觉得原住民教育落后，但其实我们这些城市人才是‘万物之耻’。” 作为一个拥有冒险精神的 90 后，郭于珂分享了她如何致力于将原住民的生活展现于大家面前。她勇敢地涉足了马来半岛的深山和茂林，与原住民建立友情，甚至与水蛭为伴，一切都是为了记录原住民的生活。她的目标不仅仅是体验他们的生活方式，更是捕捉他们的声音和影像，以便让更多人了解那些生活在森林和山川之间的朋友。他们看似遥远，却与我们息息相关。对于珂来说，踏入马来西亚原住民的世界，目睹他们多样的面孔和信仰，揭示了真正的马来西亚精髓。这促使城市居民重新审视自己的存在方式。只有探索原住民的世界，才能揭示真正的马来西亚。

title: Tamadun Langkasuka: Merungkai Sejarah dan Masa Depan
name: Azzaha Ibrahim
bio: Azzaha Ibrahim is a multidisciplinary artist based in Kelantan who works with different media including photography, video and installation. Trained as an architect in Universiti Teknologi Malaysia (UTM), he is also an independent researcher focusing on Nusantara art and cultural heritage. Despite being in the prime of life, Azzaha chose to stay in his hometown to take care of his ailing father. The unique culture and art of Kelantan, especially the architecture of Langkasuka fascinates him. Believed to be founded over 2,000 years ago, Langkasuka was once a formidable matriarchal kingdom. As the guardian of history, Azzaha has conducted in-depth research on ancient civilizations since 1998, capturing the essence of ancient wisdom through artworks, interviews, field investigations, 3D drawings, etc., leaving a meaningful and lasting legacy for future generations.
introduction: Through architecture and arts, Azzaha Ibrahim encountered and fell in love with the civilization of Langkasuka, on which he has conducted rigorous research for over 20 years. Proposed to have been established in the 1st century A.D., Langkasuka is a matriarchal Kingdom with a unique culture. The warriors of Langkasuka were formidable and famed for their courage and fearlessness. Their sumptuous meal before a war was more than just a feast; in fact, they encoded military strategy within the arrangement of their food placement on the table.

As the guardian of history, Azzaha has conducted in-depth research on ancient civilizations since 1998, capturing the essence of ancient wisdom through artworks, interviews, field investigations, 3D drawings, etc., leaving a meaningful and lasting legacy for future generations.
translations.introduction: Through architecture and arts, Azzaha Ibrahim encountered and fell in love with the civilization of Langkasuka, on which he has conducted rigorous research for over 20 years. Proposed to have been established in the 1st century A.D., Langkasuka is a matriarchal Kingdom with a unique culture. The warriors of Langkasuka were formidable and famed for their courage and fearlessness. Their sumptuous meal before a war was more than just a feast; in fact, they encoded military strategy within the arrangement of their food placement on the table.

translations.title: 被遗忘的文明：狼牙修的过去与未来
translations.name: Azzaha Ibrahim
translations.bio: Azzaha Ibrahim，独立研究员、艺术家兼绘测师。他专于研究古代王朝、建筑、艺术和文明，其研究不局限于马来西亚，也有其他东南亚国家。尽管正值盛年，Azzaha 为了照顾生病的父亲，选择留在家乡吉兰丹。对他来说，吉兰丹拥有独特的文化艺术，其中狼牙修 (Langkasuka) 的建筑艺术令他着迷。狼牙修是一个 2 千年前存在的王国，这由女性所统领的王国，强大得不曾被侵略。1998 年开始，Azzaha 深入研究古代文明，透过手绘、访问、实地考察、3D 绘图等记录古人的智慧，为后代留下了重要的资料。身为历史守护者，他为了现在而研究过去，为了未来而留下史料。
translations.introduction: Azzaha Ibrahim 透过建筑和艺术遇见了狼牙修文明，20 多年来孜孜不倦地对其进行研究。狼牙修王国建国于公元一世纪，有着独特的文化。它是个由女性统治的王国，其战士骁勇善战，周边的国家都不敢轻易向他们开战。狼牙修的战士没有作战地图，上战场前他们都会吃上丰盛的一餐，食物的摆放就是他们的作战策略。

title: Seeing Humanity through Dystopian AI
name: Dr. Ting Yuan Sen
bio: Dr. Ting Yuan-Sen is the world-leading astrophysicist, and one of the youngest Associate Professors in astrophysics and computer science at Australian National University (ANU). He received his Ph.D. from Harvard University in 2017 and was subsequently granted a four-way fellowship from Princeton University, Carnegie Institute for Sciences, NASA Hubble, and the Institute for Advanced Study at Princeton. With more than 160 academic publications, he jointly heads the UniverseTBD collaboration, an initiative aimed at combing through the extensive corpus of astronomical literature and aspired to uncover the mechanisms behind scientific breakthroughs by fine-tuning existing foundational models.
introduction: "Artificial intelligence is a 'human-centric' science. Besides making machines smarter, AI can deeply understand the nature of human beings by imitating human behaviour and thinking." Through his research, Dr. Ting Yuan Sen focused on exploring and understanding the laws of the universe through artificial intelligence. His research team was working towards creating a "robot astronomer"; not to replace human astronomers but as a robotic professor companion to every child who was passionate about astronomy and be able to explore the mysteries of the universe together with them. Like any revolution, AI has its pros and cons. Only with in-depth study and understanding of it can we demystify AI.

event.title: Balance
event.description:
Back to track after reset.
Both personal and social recovery are ahead of us. We are more compelled than ever to pursue efficiency and achievement, as if in search of the by gone time with twofold effort...
Caught in between anxiety, stress and worries, life is like tramp over hill and dale, how swiftly time flies, are you happy within?
Body and mind are like memory cards, carrying all that we’ve been through; but in due time, clean-up and adjustment is inevitable, to restore and revive the forgotten beauty.
Life goes a long way, but is not the distance that matters; instead from ceaseless discovery and experience, seek balance inwardly, pry into innate genuine self, with a better attitude, keep pace with the times, iteratively interleaving.
Stay balance, be liberal to diversity in tune with contemporary consensus, go beyond duality, integratively reconcile opposing forces, innovatively reincarnate amidst disturbance, for the sake of concord and harmony.
The eternity of mundane world is not the concern, mastering mind-body balance always comes first, and is the key to perpetuity.

translations.title: 衡
translations.description:
重启之后回归正轨，彼此面临着
个人和社会复苏的挑战。
我们比从前更迫切追求高效和成就，
仿佛要把过去流逝的时光，
都双倍寻找回来……
焦虑、压力与患得患失之间，生活像翻山越岭，
时间走得快了，内心是否快乐？
身心如同储存卡，承载我们所经历的一切；
但适当时候，总得好好清理调整一遍，
才能重现美好。

生活漫漫远行，
却不在于走多长的路；而是从不断发现和经历，
寻觅内心平衡，窥探自己最真实一面，
再以更好的姿态，
与时俱进，迭代交织。
平衡思维，驱使时代理解并包容多元观点，
打破二元对立的局限，融汇相对之力，
于纷扰创新轮回，达到共融与和谐。
不困念尘世是否可得永恒，
更重要的是掌握身心平衡。
身心平衡，方为永恒。

translations.name: Dr. Ting Yuan Sen
translations.bio: Dr. Ting Yuan-Sen is the world-leading astrophysicist, and one of the youngest Associate Professors in astrophysics and computer science at Australian National University (ANU). He received his Ph.D. from Harvard University in 2017 and was subsequently granted a four-way fellowship from Princeton University, Carnegie Institute for Sciences, NASA Hubble, and the Institute for Advanced Study at Princeton. Like any revolution, AI has its pros and cons. Only with in-depth study and understanding of it can we demystify AI.

translations.title: 通过 AI 黑镜看见人类本质
translations.name: 丁源森博士
translations.bio: 丁源森博士，天体物理学家，现任澳洲国立大学副教授。 他在天文学和电脑科学两个部门进行教学与研究工作，并使用机器学习技术，研究天文大数据的统计和推理。 2017 年他在哈佛大学获得天文学和天体物理学的博士学位。之后，他成为了第一位在普林斯顿大学、卡内基科学研究、NASA 哈勃和普林斯顿高等研究院获得联合奖学金的学者。他是 NASA 恒星科学兴趣小组的联席主席，参与领导未来的多个光谱巡天项目。迄今，他已经参与编写了超过 160 篇的学术论文。
translations.introduction: “人工智能是一门 ‘以人为本’ 的科学。它不只是让机器变得聪明，更希望通过模仿人类的行为和思维，深入理解人类的本质。” 日常研究和教学工作中，丁源森博士专注于通过人工智能去探索和理解宇宙的运行规律。他的研究团队的一个重要方向是创建一个 “机器天文学家”。这目的不是为了取代天文学家，而是想通过这种方式，让每一个对天文学有热情的孩子，无论身在何处都能有一个 “机器教授好朋友”，与他们一起探索宇宙的奥秘。如同任何革命性的新事物，AI 带有双面性，唯有不断深入认识，才能打破对它的迷思。

title: Deciphering Typography and Local Aesthetic
name: Tan Sueh Li
occupation: Founder and Typeface Designer of Huruf
bio: Tan Sueh Li is the founder and typeface designer of Huruf. Driven by her passion for exploring multi-script typography and font development, Sueh Li founded Huruf with a desire to discover a unique Malaysian identity in typography and type design. Grab Community, a type family she co-designed for the superapp Grab, received a Certificate of Typographic Excellence in the 2021 Typeface Design Competition from the Type Directors Club in New York. Sueh Li hopes to take us on a journey of discovering local aesthetics, cultural significance, and stories by looking at signboards on the streets and sharing with us the inspiring lessons she learnt from these observations.
introduction: “Besides reflecting Malaysia’s unique visual culture, shop signs are also a record of the culture, history, economy, politics, and lifestyle at the time; as if they are living textbooks on the streets.”Typeface designer Tan Sueh Li has been conducting her research on typography in the context of cultural integration over the years. She described how “multilingualism” and “multi-literacy” is a distinct cultural phenomenon in Malaysia’s shop signs. Over time the traces left by these diverse fonts and craftsmanship have become symbols and epitomes of a place’s memories, while also representing the cultural identities of the locals. Her observations have taught her to respect the expertise and pair of hands behind the creation of every sign. It gave her the courage to reconnect with the community and rediscover the places where she grew up with a renewed perspective.

event.title: Balance
event.description:
Back to track after reset.
Both personal and social recovery are ahead of us. We are more compelled than ever to pursue efficiency and achievement, as if in search of the by gone time with twofold effort...
Caught in between anxiety, stress and worries, life is like tramp over hill and dale, how swiftly time flies, are you happy within?
Body and mind are like memory cards, carrying all that we’ve been through; but in due time, clean-up and adjustment is inevitable, to restore and revive the forgotten beauty.
Life goes a long way, but is not the distance that matters; instead from ceaseless discovery and experience, seek balance inwardly, pry into innate genuine self, with a better attitude, keep pace with the times, iteratively interleaving.
Stay balance, be liberal to diversity in tune with contemporary consensus, go beyond duality, integratively reconcile opposing forces, innovatively reincarnate amidst disturbance, for the sake of concord and harmony.
The eternity of mundane world is not the concern, mastering mind-body balance always comes first, and is the key to perpetuity.

translations.title: 从字体设计到地方美学的文化阅读
translations.name: 陈姝利
translations.occupation: Huruf 创办人兼字体与平面设计师
translations.bio: 陈姝利，Huruf 创办人兼字体与平面设计师。她热衷于在排版和字体设计中探索多语言性，希望在排版和字体设计中找到马来西亚的独特身份，为此创办 “Huruf”。她在 2021 年凭着 “Grab Community" 字样获得纽约字体指导俱乐部 (Type Director Club Awards, New York) 的字体设计组别奖。她希望带大家一起到街上走一趟看招牌，从字体细读其中的在地美学、文化意义和人文故事，并分享这些年来 “走街看字” 所学习到的和被启发的。
translations.introduction: “店铺招牌除了反映马来西亚独特的在地视觉文化，也记录了当时社会的文化、历史、经济、政治和人民的生活方式，就好像是街上活生生的教科书。”字体设计师陈姝利多年来的研究方向都在文化融合的语境下展开。她介绍，“多语言”、“多文种” 是我国招牌所呈现的奇特文化现象，随着时间的演变，多样的字体与工艺留下的痕迹，已然成为了一个地方记忆的符号与缩影，也代表着当地人的文化身份认同。透过观察，她学会了尊重创作以及招牌背后的每一双手；也让她有勇气走进社区、发掘人文故事，并重新看待自己成长的地方。

title: Youth Power: Shaping the Future of the Community
name: Chua Li Cheng
bio: Chua Li Cheng is a member of Colllab, an independent architecture research, innovation and fabrication lab. She graduated with a degree in architecture from UCSI University. Together with other aspiring architects, they venture into communities to assist those in need by implementing various community outreach programs. Using their professional knowledge, they contributed to projects such as educating the community on the operation and maintenance of community buildings, and how to create a better community environment. Some of the projects Li Cheng and her team have completed include the Kampung Dato Keramat Library in Selangor and a children’s playground in Kampung Belemang, Johor. She is also an executive member of “Draf.”, Malaysia’s first Chinese architecture media, which endeavours to promote the development of architecture education in Malaysia.
introduction: Having often wondered how best to help those in need, Chua Li Cheng joined a group of like-minded young architects at “Colllab” to organise outreach programs that build up and cultivate their local communities. They have helped build flower gardens, libraries, and other projects in unseen corners. This goes beyond unveiling new potential for the community: together with residents of these communities, “Colllab” is creating a different landscape and finding out how to conceptualise and realise a better vision for their homes.

translations.title: 青年力量：塑造社区未来
translations.name: 蔡俐贞
translations.bio: 蔡俐贞，Colllab 社计手成员之一。她毕业于马来西亚思特雅大学 (UCSI) 建筑系，目前是助理建筑师。她与一群有志的建筑师走进社区协助居民执行了各种社区建造活动。她以自身专业帮助有需要的群众，并改善社区生活质量，包括建筑设计及教育居民维持社区建筑，打造更好的社区环境。她与团队完成了多个社区项目，包括在雪兰莪州的 Kampung Dato Keramat 社区图书馆, 以让每个儿童有机会阅读；以及柔佛州的 Kampung Belemang 乡村儿童游乐园，让孩子有个好地方接触大自然环境、快乐成长。此外，她也是马来西亚中文建筑教育媒体《草稿》执行团队成员之一，努力推动马来西亚建筑教育发展。
translations.introduction: 蔡俐贞时常思考，该如何以自身专业帮助有需要的人群、如何为社区带入建筑设计。因此她加入 Colllab 社计手，与一群有志的青年建筑师走出校园，在社区用心耕耘，完成了多个社区建造项目。在我们看不见的角落里，有着他们建造的社区花园、公共图书馆等。他们不仅为社区居民带来了不一样的可能性，更将一套完好的理念传授予居民，与居民一同打造社区新景象，将心中的美好家园一一实现。

title: Environmental Education:More Than Just Recycling
name: Chong Kah Yee
bio: Chong Kah Yee is the co-founder of Let's RE, an environmental education workshop. She graduated from the Institute of Environmental Education at National Taiwan Normal University, specializing in promoting environmental education through easy-to-understand knowledge, online content, and offline activities to alert the public's concern for the earth. Kah Yee hopes to bring people closer to nature through her efforts in environmental protection. By protecting nature's beauty together, she hopes to achieve the goal of realizing a harmonious coexistence between humans and nature.
introduction: “Have you ever thought about the preciousness of water sources?” 97% of our daily water supply comes from rivers, but how much do we truly understand about this source of life? Chong Kah Yee used various means to spread environmental awareness, affecting people around her and thereby creating a profound impact. She awakened people to the beauty of preserving nature and inspired them to work together to achieve the goal of harmonious coexistence between humans and nature.

Caught in between anxiety, stress and worries, life is like tramp over hill and dale, how swiftly time flies, are you happy within?
Body and mind are like memory cards, carrying all that we’ve been through; but in due time, clean-up and adjustment is inevitable, to restore and revive the forgotten beauty.
Life goes a long way, but is not the distance that matters; instead from ceaseless discovery and experience, seek balance inwardly, pry into innate genuine self, with a better attitude, keep pace with the times, iteratively interleaving.
Stay balance, be liberal to diversity in tune with contemporary consensus, go beyond duality, integratively reconcile opposing forces, innovatively reincarnate amidst disturbance, for the sake of concord and harmony.
The eternity of mundane world is not the concern, mastering mind-body balance always comes first, and is the key to perpetuity.

translations.title: Balance
translations.description:
Back to track after reset.
Both personal and social recovery are ahead of us. We are more compelled than ever to pursue efficiency and achievement, as if in search of the by gone time with twofold effort...
Caught in between anxiety, stress and worries, life is like tramp over hill and dale, how swiftly time flies, are you happy within?
Body and mind are like memory cards, carrying all that we’ve been through; but in due time, clean-up and adjustment is inevitable, to restore and revive the forgotten beauty.
Life goes a long way, but is not the distance that matters; instead from ceaseless discovery and experience, seek balance inwardly, pry into innate genuine self, with a better attitude, keep pace with the times, iteratively interleaving.
Stay balance, be liberal to diversity in tune with contemporary consensus, go beyond duality, integratively reconcile opposing forces, innovatively reincarnate amidst disturbance, for the sake of concord and harmony.
The eternity of mundane world is not the concern, mastering mind-body balance always comes first, and is the key to perpetuity.

translations.title: 衡
translations.description:
重启之后回归正轨，彼此面临着
个人和社会复苏的挑战。
我们比从前更迫切追求高效和成就，
仿佛要把过去流逝的时光，
都双倍寻找回来……
焦虑、压力与患得患失之间，生活像翻山越岭，
时间走得快了，内心是否快乐？
身心如同储存卡，承载我们所经历的一切；
但适当时候，总得好好清理调整一遍，
才能重现美好。

生活漫漫远行，
却不在于走多长的路；而是从不断发现和经历，
寻觅内心平衡，窥探自己最真实一面，
再以更好的姿态，
与时俱进，迭代交织。
平衡思维，驱使时代理解并包容多元观点，
打破二元对立的局限，融汇相对之力，
于纷扰创新轮回，达到共融与和谐。
不困念尘世是否可得永恒，
更重要的是掌握身心平衡。
身心平衡，方为永恒。

translations.title: Environmental Education:More Than Just Recycling
translations.name: Chong Kah Yee
translations.bio: Chong Kah Yee is the co-founder of Let's RE, an environmental education workshop. She graduated from the Institute of Environmental Education at National Taiwan Normal University, specializing in promoting environmental education through easy-to-understand knowledge, online content, and offline activities to alert the public's concern for the earth. Kah Yee hopes to bring people closer to nature through her efforts in environmental protection. By protecting nature's beauty together, she hopes to achieve the goal of realizing a harmonious coexistence between humans and nature.
translations.introduction: “Have you ever thought about the preciousness of water sources?” 97% of our daily water supply comes from rivers, but how much do we truly understand about this source of life? Chong Kah Yee used various means to spread environmental awareness, affecting people around her and thereby creating a profound impact. She awakened people to the beauty of preserving nature and inspired them to work together to achieve the goal of harmonious coexistence between humans and nature.

translations.title: 环境教育不只是环保
translations.name: 锺嘉怡
translations.occupation: Let’s RE 环境教育工作室创办人
translations.bio: 锺嘉怡，Let’s RE 环境教育工作室创办人，身兼永续社区协会 (SustainableX) 的秘书与活动策划。现任吉隆坡循人中学 “社会时事 - 环境保护” 课程讲师。毕业于台湾国立师范大学环境教育研究所，擅长以浅显易懂的知识，结合线上内容和线下活动的方式积极推广环境教育，以期唤醒大众对地球的关心。她希望透过环境保护，重新拉近人和自然环境的关系，一起守护美好，并从中得到启发，一起实现人类与自然环境和谐共存的目标。
translations.introduction: “你是否曾想过水源的珍贵？” 97% 的日常用水来自河流， 可我们对这个生命之源了解多少呢？ 锺嘉怡透过各种方式方式传播环保知识， 不经意地改变身边的人， 继而产生深远的影响力， 唤醒人们守护自然的美好， 共同实现人与自然和谐共存的目标。

title: Programming Language: Let's Start Coding Together
name: Lee Zhi Guan
bio: Lee Zhi Guan is a practitioner in technology education. He was inspired by the education systems in China and Taiwan and realized how education could change someone’s life. Hence, he is motivated to advocate for technology education in Malaysia and to bridge the gap between technology education in Malaysia and abroad. Zhi Guan hopes to lay a foundation for Malaysia’s future by integrating science and technology into our education system. His wish is that Malaysian students can thrive and succeed in the field of science and technology.
introduction: Technology educator Lee Zhi Guan was deeply inspired by his exposure to different education systems during his experience abroad. Upon returning to Malaysia, he strove to bridge the gap between science and technology education locally and abroad, thus providing students with further learning opportunities. He believes that his effort will create a vibrant and innovative society.

translations.title: 编程语言：一起 Coding 吧 !
translations.name: 李智源
translations.bio: 李智源，科技教育工作者。2016 年他独自前往中国和台湾打工，体验不同的教育体制，深受启发。2019 年他加入科技教育领域，领悟教育之美，看到科技教育创变未来。有感马来西亚科技教育与世界有差距，于是回国致力于填补空白，而激情和使命驱使他积极推广科技教育，为学生创造机会。他期望马来西亚学子在科技领域有出色的表现，并取得辉煌的成就。李智源选择凸显了他对教育和科技的理解，积极贡献社会。这不仅让他找到职业方向，也为马来西亚未来奠基，将科技教育融入体系，为学生成长铺平道路。他的努力将塑造更有活力、创新力的社会。
translations.introduction: 李智源曾飘洋过海探索不同教育体系，深受启发。回国后，致力于拉近马来西亚科技教育的差距，为学生创造机会。他相信可以通过努力塑造出有活力和充满创新力的社会。
